name: Ksamil Caravan Camping
description: Very friendly campsite, five minutes from one beach, ten from another

name: Public parking
description: At a huge crater which used to be a lake.

name: Camping
description: Campsite run by family just opened. They still have to learn something, but are very friendly.

name: Camping Peschku
description: Highly recommended! Very nice owner and beautiful grassy spots right at the lake for 10euros (car with rooftent and two persons). Also very nice restaurant where you van pick your own fish which will be prepared on the spot so fresh!

name: Lake Shkodra Resort
description:
Beautiful terrain at lake with excellent restaurant. Bicycles for rent.

Open from 01/04 to 31/10. 5€ per person per night(01/07-31/08 is 7€). 0.5€/1€/2€ for motor/car/camper per night.

Beside opening time, can stay for free with toilet open.

name: Peshkopi, Camping Kapxhiu
description: The camping is situated in the wine and fruit orchard of the family Kapxhiu, next to the river Lixhave. The camping is on 10 minutes walking distance from the centre of Peshkopi. The camping has places for tents and a few places for camper or caravans and two bed & breakfast rooms. Peshkopi is located in the northeast of Albania, in de Dibër-mountains. It is well located for hikes, trekking, mountain biking and off-roading. Trips to mount Korab (2745m) or Marovo in Macedonia. You can also order home-cooked meals and breakfast which is fresh and very good. This campsite is very clean and family Kapxhiu will help travelers with anything they need. It is not, however, suitable for big camper vans. Free WiFi on the veranda!

name: Camping Legjenda
description:
Nice, fancier campsite, only been open 1 year. Limited shady spots at far end near showers and toilets (very clean) as trees have to grow. Fast wifi (1.5MB/sec) Nice restaurant right next door. Fuel station just out by road for beer/snacks. You can fill up water tanks. Electricity on sites (3.5 euro), adult 7 euro per night, 2 euro for a car, 1 euro for tent.

Bar, restaurant, apartments on site. Cooking area and laundry available.

name: Riverbed Malind
description: Great spot next to the river. Several places nearby. Few cars come by and very friendly. Nice dip in the river.

name: Camping ARBI
description: We ended up here after a very rough 4x4 day west of Sotire. Very nice grassy campsite. Very clean, all amenities, wifi throughout. High poplars give shade first half of the day. Restaurant. Next to the lake. Quiet. Recommended. Note: Camping very hard west of Maliq; narrow gorge, dam is being built!

name: Oasi Alla Chiesa
description: Campsite around a small church, run by sisters. Grass, but not level everywhere. Trees for shade. River nearby. We paid 5 Euro pp. Washing machine and wifi available. Lovely place.

name: Shëngjerg View
description: What a view! After a rough 4x4 ride we got a drink at the bar next to the old mosque in Shengjerg. The guys invited us to stay and we found a spot on the plateau up from the mosque/bar where a radio mast stands. 360 degree view and a chance to watch valley life. Awesome spot. Please enquire at the bar. Roads to village from either Klos (north) or Labinot /Elbasan (south) are 4x4 only.

name: Saddle View
description: On the way from Shengjerg to Klos we stopped at this great spot. We did not spend the night, but would be a great place. Just follow the track from the road for 50 meters or so. Great view on this saddle. Road is 4x4 only.

name: Guesthouse Kola Gjoni
description: Guesthouse and camping. Great place near Valbonë but away from the road. Possible to camp or park on grass. Homecooked Food is amazing here! 5 Euro pp per night for camping. Close to trailhead to Mount Rosit.

name: Guesthouse & Camping Peraj
description: Lovely spot in the idyllic Vermosh valley. Daughter Florida speaks English well and is very attentive. They have rooms and a big pasture where you can camp/park with a covered picknick area. Toilets and shower inside the guesthouse. Wifi available. Very good homecooked food. Close to small border crossing with Montenegro. Camping pp. 5 Euro, dinner 6 Euro pp. Note: the road from Koplik to about Selcë is paved (EU project), further to Vermosh under construction. Great ride and surroundings.

name: Hotel-Restaurant Colombo / Camping
description: The Hotel and Restaurant Colombo offers a spot for campers, water, and wifi! The owner is very nice and he also offered me a shower in one of the hotel rooms! (Maybe I looked like 5 days without a shower!? ;)) I payed 5€ p.N.! It's next to a street, so not super quiet...

name: Blue Camping/Camping Kranea
description: Beautiful camping run by German immigrants . Cosy place with olive trees which provide sufficient shade with hammocks and sun loungers . Very clean sanitary  .(Wunderschöner Camping der von deutschen Auswanderern geführt wird. Gemütlicher Platz mit Olivenbäumen die für ausreichenden Schatten sorgen mit  Hängematten und Sonnenliegen. Sehr sauber Sanitäreanlage. )

name: Kamping Pa Emer
description: camping directly on the sea . closer it gets. dark sand . WC and shower  is okay . Unfortunately reachable only by much gradual and not illuminated . reception is a block house where you can rent rooms . English owners . caravan price 23 € / per night.     you can eat 150 m right of the camping a wonderful fresh fish. evening take a torch!!!

name: MOSKATO Camping
description: This is well established campground about 50meters from the beach. It's run by great guy Vasil, he speaks good English and will help with any situation. The camp is good for tents as well as campers. For one motorcycle and one person in tent I paid 600Leke (around 4Euro)

name: The Blue Eye
description: In parking lot of the hotel/bar/restaurant right next to the Blue Eye. Very quiet place at night. Bit crowded by day. Restaurant closes at dinnertime.

name: Gjipe Beach & Camping (free)
description: Free campsite with toilet and private beach with beach bar. Drive into monastery carpark & continue down a rough dirt track for 1.5kms. Dedicated, manicured grassy spaces for cars & tents, dirt road likely not suitable for large rigs or trailers; 4WD only. Beach bar played music, umbrellas for shade, lots happening on this isolated beach. No showers. Bins.

name: Camping "Natura" Koman
description:
A very simple Campground and Hotel under the bridge. The Owner is very friendly and we payed 10€. They also have a good restaurant. 
It is open all year!

name: Mountain top parking
description: A very big parking lot at the dead end road to the mountain top. Almost level. Enormous view over Krujë and even Tirana. Quiet at night. The road leading to this place is also very nice and in good condition.

name: luke warm springs
description:
nice place with warm springs restaurant/ cafe nearby. At night quiet and lonely place. 
4 g internet available albtelecom.

name: Offroad Restaurant
description: Very nice family runs a Restaurant on a nice offroad street. A 'must' visit for Albanian tourists.

name: Berat Caravan Camping
description: Good campsite half an hour north of Berat. There is nothing closer to Berat. The family who run it are very friendly and they have a restaurant selling there own wine. Very accommodating and let us pitch our tent in their garden as it was much drier than the rest of the campsite after a huge storm. Good WiFi and showers. €15/2000 Leke for 2 people with tent.

name: Camping Tirana
description:
Open since 2015, Camping Tirana is the ideal solution for visitors wishing to experience Tirana. The site, located next to Kusi Lake, is a true oasis in the heart of nature covered by vineyards, olives and a variety of fruit trees; only 30 minutes drive from the Port of Durres; 20 minutes drive from Tirana and 15 minutes from Mother Teresa Airport! We offer camping sites for tents, motorcycles, cars, motor homes, campers, camper vans etc.
We are only 80 meters away from Kusi Lake shore, where our guest can enjoy the beach, swim or take a canoe ride. A floating trampoline is set on the lake as well as various canoes and dinghies.
Currently the site has  showers,  bathrooms, a washing machine, dishwasher, and internet. A common indoor area with tables & chairs is also available.
The staff at Camping Tirana awaits your arrival with a welcoming drink, Raki of course, our local specialty! Cheers and Welcome to Camping Tirana!

name: Farma Sotira
description: Farma Sotira Hostel, Camping, swimming pool For a truck and 2 persons = 15 € with Electricity, sanitary, swimming pool and breafast included. Very pleasant stage in the middle of the farm, with possibility to taste delicious trout cooked for you

name: Taverna-Lazaro
description: In the olives behind the restaurant . Quiet , nice place just near the castel KALA. 10 Euro/night.

name: Great spot on the river
description:
A beautiful camp spot on a stream flowing into the Black Drini. Beautiful area and great road to drive. Nice swimming. In view of the road but all friendly locals. 
Just turn off the road on the south side of the bridge.

name: bar te cuki
description: nice small camp site, no food but 5m across the street there is an ok restaurant with food. very nice owner, good beer and good slivovitz/raki. wifi from across restaurant Shower available at the private house of the owner, but he is working on updates

name: nice spot next to river
description:
Flat camping spot on a river. 3G network works (Vodafone sim)
Albtelecom didn't work. No surprise in the deep valley.

EDIT: Not suitable for every vehicle, read the comments.

name: Lukove beach
description: Update nov 2018 : as mentioned, the road is washed away. Dead end

name: Parku Kombetar beach wildcamp
description: Camped on top of little dunes surrounded by water. Stunning views over the lagune. Only some fishermen around. 4x4 only.

name: grassy field on the river
description: 50 m from bridge and drive all the way to the river and then right and there is a grassy field and a ruin. Perfect camping spot with a beautiful view.

name: Into a canyon
description:
right  300 m from the road near a little river a small place with fireplace. place for some small tents or a car. so far no waist on this site  and very a quiet place. in the last 2 hours ~3 cars on the road.
we camped with two motorbikes and one tent. many flys but no moskitos

name: Valley near Theth
description: Big flat grassy area with lots of camping space. Bit of shade near the trees, river nearby.

name: Hotel Baron
description: Parking lot of the hotel for small campers. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Bus station in front of the hotel.

name: Top of the hill
description: Half an hour hike to the top of the hill, a good place to pich the tent, make a little fire and enjoy the view of the town

name: Liqeni i Thate
description:
Place only for 4X4 vehicles. Quietly situated on a lake
----
Nur mit Allrad zu erreichen. Sehr ruhig gelegen direkt am See

name: Auto servis Japan Gezimi
description:
specialized in 4x4 vehicles. Really good mechanics know what they are doing. our crankshaft pulley was broken and they couldn't find any spare one near by. so they repaired it, which took 6 hours, because the fix had to dry. And now 10.000 km further it's still working with no problem. price was really. good as well. 
(do not speak English so Google translate could be useful)

name: Nord Park Hotel
description: Nord Park Hotel with pool with hot shower at the hotel. 24€ for overnight stays.

name: shkodera
description:
prêt du terrain de camping un parking devant terrain sport couvert
near official camp ground à car Park front soccer  field indoor : free

name: Stone Pit Camping
description:
Nice place for one night in the Qafshtama National Park.
It is a bit above a gravel road and you can be seen from the road but there is not much traffic. The ground is not completely flat and could be muddy on rainy days.
At least one hiking trail starts here and goes up the hill (very nice). You can also see the sunrise between the trees when the weather is good. You can even see the sea from your van.

name: Wild camping on beach
description:
Huge beach where you can drive with your car. We just parked next to the "road" on the sand. The sand is not really deep. But I think you could have problems when your car is very heavy. With our fully loaded VW T5 Campervan it was no problem. 
Just a handful of fisherman drive by. Very silent by night

name: Alone with the sheep
description: There is a big flat and grassy area on the left side of the gravel road. You will have a very nice view and even an access to the sea. There is also a hiking trail over the beaches of the national park. We spent two nights here and have just seen cows, sheep and a friendly shepherd. Also a great place for sunsets!

name: Castle Ali Pashe
description: There is a castle on a small isle next to the street. You will have a private guided tour. The guide doesn't speak English very well, but he ist very engaged and friendly! And all this for a price of less than 1€ per person! (100Lek)

name: Border area
description:
When you are on the way to the Greek border, turn right after you see a small memorial place on the left (picture). You turn into a short gravel road which leads to a grassy flat area on the right. If you have 4x4 you could probably drive down to park directly next to the river.
Nice place, with access to the river and a great view up to the mountains.

name: Piccola Venezia
description:
sur un terrain à côté du resto les propriétaires nous ont autoriséspossibilité utiliser les toilettes belle vue sur la. lagune chanceux coucher de soleil à midi nous avions déjeuné pour 1500 leks
on a field near restaurant owner's accepted than we stay we can use restroom biutifull view on laguna Sun set We have lunch at noon1500 leks for 2

name: laguna Divjake
description: On sand road to the beach near an official camping

name: Dvijake bird watching
description: Good site for birdwatching..........................

name: Sankt Antonius
description: Dead end road  to Sankt Antonius roman church restrooms small bar restaurant on the beach.

name: Refill bottle gas right from the coast
description: gaz station Wright enter village coming from sea

name: Berat Universite
description:
en face de l'Université un terrain vague au bord de la rivière
front Université à noman's Land near river

name: corcovode
description: In front of the market and gas station Ermal.

name: Pojan Apolonia
description:
Pojan Apollonia sur le parking WC et eau heures d'ouvertures on a demandé l'autorisation au responsable
Pojan Apollonia on the car park. toilets and water during opening hours. Ask prior permission from the manager

name: on the beach
description: near old police station on the beach  nous problem od road it's notre highway

name: Vlorë  port
description: Very well located, guarded 6 € / 24 h without toilet service in a shopping center (300 m).

name: monastary san teodoro
description:
ne pas passer avec un véhicule de plus de 2 m de large environ 2 kms de route étroite
non service
---
do not pass with a vehicle more than 2 m wide
about 2 kms of narrow road 
no service

name: Himare beach boulevard
description:
en face RED INDIAN stationnement sur la rue wifi du bar toute la nuit bière pression en saison
front RED INDIAN on the street wfi free draft beer summer

name: Gjirokaster Kamping
description: Small camping 8€; power, no hot morning shower,

name: Camper Stop Cekodhima
description: Close to Vlorë. More of a camper parking than a camping, but with clean toilets, showers and directly at the water front. Onsight restaurant (closed when I was there). I was the only one, enjoying the sound of the waves and the view of lightning over the Ionian sea! Still off-season, so I paid 5 euro for 1 person, tent and motorbike. Very friendly owner. Wifi password:[Password removed by Moderator.]

name: Meadow with a view near Zall-Reç
description: Quiet Place in the near of the River black Drin. Obove a Gravelroad there is a pice of Gras with a Fireplace. Fantasic View over the Black Drin Valley. Frindly local People keeps on geeting from several hundert meters away. Place enough for 3 or 4 Overlanders and much more Bikes. I was here by two Bikes and one Tent at 17 September 2017

name: Place with a nice surrouding
description:
A parking where people will leave you alone and let just park up there to sleep for a couple of nights.

There are fisher men and there is the Butrint Roman Empire attraction that you can see for 6 euro's. (residue of the Roman time and a castle from the 16th century).

Mind you, there is a ferry that crosses south here that will cost you between 5 to 10 euro's depending on what vehicle you drive and it also makes some sound at nighttime!

name: Place between mountains with a river
description:
Lovely place to spend the night, or a couple of nights, with a campervan or a tent. There is a gas station next door and people will leave you alone. Mind the (small-ish) dog that they have. 
The road there is good to drive on!
We really enjoyed staying here. Also if you don't want to be on this main road you can drive on and check other spots + 10 km further away there is a restaurant where they have mineral water spots to fill your bottle or watertank!!

name: Landi Campsite
description:
Small campsite behind coffee shop. Shower, free WiFi, electricity and water. 
1 tent is five only Euro per night.

Landi the owner is very friendly and speaks English very well. He also understands German, Greek and Italian.

name: Hotel Victoria
description: Right on the lake, Lake Ohrid, and it is a beautiful quiet location (we were here 5th Nov 2017). You can have use of the hotel facilities, bar, food and access to night toilet and shower in available room. Very friendly owner who speaks fluent english.

name: erlin camping
description: nice camping on the edge of the lake ohrid. beach. bar. restaurant warm shower. flat. no trees. on green . 1500 leke for 2+motorhome

name: sunset camping
description: actually on construction right on the beach. on green and stone. good restaurant. hot shower. nice view

name: Restorant 32
description:
Nice local restaurant, very friendly people who speak English. 
Try the Baked cheese with sesame and honey: heavenly good!!!

name: Camping Vlora
description: Nice campsite with good facilities all new and good value €5 for camping 1 person with Moto. 20€ for 2 Person with pick up and rooftop Rent.

name: camping late
description:
hostel € 10 the bed included breakfast ... is a private house and has several rooms and you can store the motorcycle in the garden in front of the room. the family that runs it is lovely 
---
hostel 10€ la cama desayuno incluido...es una casa particular y tiene varias habitaciones y puedes guardar la moto en el jardin frente a la habitacion. la familia que regenta son encantadores 😀👍

name: Borsh Beach
description: Large beach with small hotels and bars. We parked on the beach nearby a bar called Jürgen. Nobody was disturbing us. The Wi-Fi from Jürgen bar is jurgen11.

name: Vithkuq Reservoir
description: Site right by a lake with gorgeous views. Accessible by a gravel road. There’s a track down past an abandoned and demolished house. Site is visible from the road and there is some road noise - especially construction trucks working on a water line. But the view makes up for it. Quiet at night. No one bothered us. Shepard and sheep came by in the afternoon.

name: Parku Hotova Fir - Mountaintop View
description: Good gravel road from SH75. We pulled into a beautiful field off of the road. Looks out over the entire valley. We are inside the National Park but there are villages. We were visited by one nice herder. Not much traffic on the road (3 cars). Very peaceful.

name: Mrizi i Zanave
description:
Go here! Famous restaurant and rightly so. Fresh farm products. There is no menu. They serve about 10 courses. Excellent food. And the cost is only 3250 lek for two people (4200 in 2021 with desert). That’s just €26 (35 euro in 2021) total for two. Plus drinks. Cash and credit card and reservation highly recommended. We called same day and got a reservation. tel:+355 69 210 8032. Website: http://www.mrizizanave.al

Some people in campers said they were allowed to spend the night in the parking lot. they have space fir around 6 campers. 
But it's a decent parking area only for campers, comparable to the average camping side, they even have electricity and WiFi ( but only near the restaurant not directly on the camping area). The only thing missing are showers.

name: Abandoned Mountain Road
description: 4x4 or motorcycle only to go up the unused track labeled as Old Ungrej Road on Maps.me. Wide open gravel area to camp. No one around. Beautiful views. Quiet. Not level but plenty of rocks and easy to dig. Good Vodafone 3G signal.

name: Beautiful Meadow with 360 Mountain View
description: If you’re traveling on the gravel road to Theth, take the grassy track on maps.me into a meadow full of wildflowers. Stunning mountain views. We found a flat spot in the meadow. On the map, there appears to be a hiking route passing through this area, but we didn’t see any hikers when we were here in July. Very, very beautiful & peaceful.

name: Kastrioti Motors
description: Land Rover specialists. Recommended to us by a local for repairs on our Jeep Wrangler. Beautiful, large, modern facility. Very nice English speaking owner, and the mechanic who worked on our truck spoke English as well. They welded a part that broke on our front axel, and they did it while we waited. Excellent price. Recommend!

name: Border Albania to Montenegro
description:
One stop border. If you need vehicle insurance for Montenegro, you stamp your passport first and then park. The insurance booth is right behind the police/customs booth. They charge €15 for 15 days. 
If you are going into Albania, there are people selling vehicle insurance for Albania at the border. And it is expensive.

name: Camping Villa Juri
description: Nice small family owned camping, really close to the city. The owners are really helpful and lovely people nd you must try their traditional dinner.

name: open meadow
description: This otherwise beautiful area hardly offers any possibilities to go off the main road and find a fairly quiet spot. It is one of the very few open and reasonably flat fields, accessible on a fair track and overlooking the beautiful surroundings.

name: Plazhi Semanit
description: There are two or three roads leading to this stretch of the coast. The parking area is used by local beach goers and anglers. It is certainly not award winning, no trees and hence no shade, but quiet at night and nobody cares.

name: Great viewpoint with spot for tent
description:
Next to gravel road with amazing view. Somehow in sight of the road, but you can manage to set up your tent in a hidden spot. In the evening 10 cars passed us within the last hour of sunlight. 
It’s a bit noisy though as there is some kind of power station with ventilation.

name: El Dorado Camping
description: Pretty random place but quiet and right at the sea. Bars and restaurants are within walking distance. Even in high season plenty of space and very nice people. Also very good price: 10euros or 1200lek per night for two persons and Landcruiser with rooftent.

name: Quiet place by lake
description:
Nice place in a forest next to a lake.
There is a little bar/cafè nearby but it seems to be closed. Although people or farmers live there.
Use the little gravel road (No need for 4x4) which is 50 meters after the cafè. You will drive into the forest and can choose a nice place where to stand.

name: Agora farmhouse
description:
New campsite , an ideal place to stay over night for the koman ferry. About 20 km/1h to the ferry.
Verry friendly people and verry good restaurant. On the lake for swimming. 

Agora.farmhouse(instagram)
Agoracompany2018@gmail.com

name: Castle Park (4x4 needed)
description: Cool and private spot near Castle Park hotel and Berat city. Coming from the city, after passing the hotel there is a steep damaged road to the right in a sharp bend of the main road. Use low gear and avoid the holes to get to the spot. There is plenty of room to turn around before going down again.

name: Beautiful Place Directly To The Sea
description:
Spot away from everything. Great view to the ocean and sunset. 
Also a small beach for swimming. In the late evening some fisherman came. But they don‘t care about you, maybe a curios.

name: Restaurant Panorama
description: About 6 Spots at The Restaurant/ Camping/Panorama. 5€ p/spot - Shower (very simple, originally for The stuff) and toilets. Very good food at the restaurant. Great ocean view and Llogona Pass.

name: Border Albania-Macedonia
description: Small border office between Albania and Macedonia. Few vehicles. Fast. Macedonian guard welcomes us with smile.

name: Parking lot for big rigs
description: Access to the Gjirokastër Castle. Free parking lot for bus and big rigs. Ideal to visit the city. Inclined ground.

name: Next to Serena Bar
description: Just after Serena Bar a public parking towards the beach. The food at Serena Bar is really good and you can get wifi from it too. Sleep right at the beach in the middle of this busy city

name: Boga Alpine resort
description: Camping with guesthouse in Boga near National Park of Theth and Shkodra lake. The owner is very nice person. We stay in camping but it's also possible to stay in the guesthouse. Bar and restaurant inside the camping. Small swimming pool. Dogs are allowed

name: Fushë Studën Reservoir
description:
Small track forking off the main road to the little reservoir and dam nestled alongside the beautiful beech forest. Camping on the shore or on top of the concrete dam.
Be aware that this place borders the Shebenik-Jabllanicë National Park!

name: Drin Riverside Fushe Muhurr
description:
Beautiful spot right on the water's edge. 
A small track north of Fushe Muhurr leads through the maize fields to the river. Muddy after rains. Several spots suitable for camping partially hidden by bushes. Swimming possible.

name: Drin Riverside near Fushe Muhurr
description:
Beautiful spot right at the water's edge.
About 3 km north after crossing the Muhurr Bridge turn into a dirt track leading to the river through maize fields. Muddy after rain. Several spots suitable for camping, partially hidden by bushes. Swimming possible.

name: Camping at the beach
description: Just a few meters before Torinos which is closed. We paid 10 eu for one night in a car for two people. Could park right at the beach. Wifi is avaiable and quite good. Very quiet at night

name: Hotel Rilindja
description: Nice place near Valbona river. Price 1.300 Lek.

name: Just before the meadow
description:
If you don’t want to take the steep hill to the meadow, this is a good spot as well with mountain view behind you and surrounded by trees! Very beautiful (as all spots are in this area).

We reached this spot quite easily in autumn, in a 4x4. From the viewpoint, where the tarmac ends, it took us 45 minutes to get here.

name: Nice Stop on the riverbank
description:
Place for 3-4 cars on the riverbank. It is flat. 1 place on the field could be possible for a 2wd with high clearance. The other places on the riverbank are only for 4x4.
The place is 30 m below the street and is a little bit visible from the street. Shepards could pass by.

name: Place near bridge - devoll canyon
description: There are some flat places to stay for the night on the other site of the bridge. Nothing special and visible from the street.

name: Buff Hostel
description:
Basic hostel in the center:
- very nice owner 
- 7 € dorm 
- double rooms available 
- secured parking for up to 5 motorbikes (no cars)

name: Bogove Restaurant „ARBER“
description: Camperstop with overnight, maximum long of the Campercar 8m. Maximum 8 places. Dinner, breakfast and lunch in restaurant possibly, nice place nearby river Osumi. Only 30 km to the Osumi Canyon. Good place for hiking or just for a walk. Good Albanien Kitchen, all food fresh and all from the farmers of the mountains. Nice people, Sonila is speaking English and Krenar is speaking perfectly Italian.

name: Dirt lot
description: Gravel/dirt lot just up the road from the big shopping mall. We spent two nights here and no one bothered us. Fine as a out of city stop/rest. A few dogs barking but that’s standard in Albania. Cow in the field behind.

name: Taverna Ladi
description: Highly recommend place to eat! Daily fresh fish, just out the lake. Good wine and grilled fresh vegetables! Simply delicious. Warm and welcoming owners and staff. Warm and cozy modern interior with a oven in the middle of the room. Beautiful lake view!

name: Fresh water
description: Fresh water by the side of the road. No water spout, just a water outlet.

name: Porto Novo
description: Between the beach of Porto Novo and the lake there is a grassy patch, perfectly flat, quiet and no so much garbage. We spent 3 nights here, loved it.

name: Nice place
description: Drive direction to Cape Rodonit. About 500 meters before the gate to Cape Rodonit there is in a curve to the right a way that leads straight uphill (on maps direction parking lot). Follow this way and after about another 500 meters there is a track to the right. Follow this track and you will find an almost level lawn overlooking the ocean where at least 3 cars fit. The way is in some sections very steep and you need a 4x4! Beautiful spot but don't drive further down to the beach. There is no possibility to turn and tons of rubbish :-( 4G signal with telekom.

name: The bride's hole
description: beautiful views of the canyon. place to park and have a look

name: Refill Gasbottle
description: We filled our German gasbottle here at the “Daku Oil“ Petrol station. I guess you can fill everywhere, were they sell LPG autogas. We just needed a D2 adapter. We paid for an almost empty bottle 4,50 Euro. Update: When they say full they mean full! Our 5 kg bottle had at the end about 6,5 kg (without the bottle) so have an eye on what they fill. They measure and you pay in liter. 1 liter is about 500 gramms.

name: Mountainview
description: gravel parking, nice view, some spots nearly plain, even when wet accessible for every kind of vehicle, spring water across the road, quiet at night;

name: Border Control Qafe Boti
description: Border Control. Entered Albania from Greece with own car (as EU citizen) without any problems. It took us 10 minutes because there were some cars in front of us. They only checked the passports and our german car license. Easy and friendly.

name: Camping Family Gjirokaster
description:
2 kilometres to the (old) center of Gjirokaster. Approximately 10 plain, graveled pitches for motorhomes, some space for tents on grass.
20 Euro 2pax/car/electricity
Brand new, nice, clean sanitary, hot shower,  Sewer water disposal.
Bar, staff very friendly
No Shade - trees yet too small

name: Riverside Parking
description: Nice place direct on the river. When you come from Kuc, turn left after the bridge (from Kallart right before the bridge). Then follow this track downhill. There are several spots where you can park. We drove the track till the end. You can not be seen from the street. Only 4x4 and smaller cars like our Hilux. When you have a big rig you can also park uphill (before driving down) on a big lawn. But here you can be seen but not a lot of people drive by. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Camping by River
description: Little meadow next to a crystal blue river. 4x4 needed. Well hidden.

name: Place at the river
description: Several spots in and around the wide riverbed. Not really pretty but ok for an overnight stay. No shade. Good 3G signal with t-mobile. 4x4 only

name: Camping close to footbridge
description: This is just a nice gravel parking spot next to the river. The spot is also start point for canoeing. But it was very quiet in May.

name: Bridge with weight limit 4t
description: Bridge is limted to 4t. Heavier vehicules might cross through the small (in May) rocky riverbed. The road coming from Berat via Çorovode is sealed (in changing conditions) until few km north of this point. All the way down south until junction with SH75 road between Përmet-Tepelene is a very bumpy gravel road. Recommended for 4x4 only, high clearance and low gear. It can be very slippery in some parts after rainfall.

name: Camping Bar Restaurant Korçe
description:
This is a tiny and cosy campground directly located at the lake shore. It has some areas in a nice tree shade and some places at the lake. There is a toilet and a sink, all pretty basic but clean. Showers are not running at the moment. WiFi is at the restaurant. It is 1.000Lek for two persons and a campervan.
It is a beautiful place and nice owners who do take care.
They also run the restaurant with very good fresh trout. But order exactely what you want else you might get more (and pay more) as expected.
You find the place if you turn to the left in front of the entrance of erlin camping  and follow the path for about 100m.

name: Overnight stay
description: Ok place for an overnight stay. No view but you can also not be seen from the road. Some cars during the day, quite at night. Just follow the track for about 100 meters. 4x4 only.

name: Tirana City Parking
description: Parking lot next to man-made lake in Tirana. great spot to walk everywhere. 500 leks a night or 7500 leks for a month. Water spigots in several places and a toilet. The entrance is staffed and city buses come each night to park. Can be noisy and busier on weekends with locals going to the lake.

name: Berisha Ferry between Koman and Fierze on Lake Koman
description:
There is a carferry service between the villages Koman and Fierze going once a day each way. Departure time in Koman is 9:00 and in Fierze at 13:00. Travelltime is about two and a half hours. It is a very scenic boat trip.
Tickets in adavance you can book online. Check ww.komanilakeferry.com.
Coming from Fierze there is a ticket seller at the roundabout in Fierze village. Here you can get the ticket and a reservation before heading to Valbona valley. You can also change departure date if required. Ask the ticket seller for his phone/WhatsApp number. There is another ticket seller on the way to the jetty (about 3km out off Fierze) and also at the 'harbour' itself.
Price (ticket seller, online is supposed to be a bit cheaper): footprint of the car (length multiplied with width, in squaremeter sqm): €6,00/sqm including driver, extra person add €6,00. Our van (10sqm) with two persons was €66. If they ask the price in Lek check the conversion rate. It seemed to me that price in € is better than in Lek.
Additionally there is a harbour fee of Lek200 that we had to pay at the harbour on day of travelling (seems a bit strange but we even got an official receipt).
Attention: Leaving the ferry in Koman you immediately proceed into a tunnel. So if you you want to rest at the pier be prepared. There is only limited space.
If you enter the ferry at Koman: If you pass through the tunnel the pier is directly to your left.

name: Place at the river
description: When you drive from Sotire to Gramsh you follow the track to the right direct before the river crossing. Follow the left track (the track splits after about 10 meters) along the river and you will reach this place. There is also a big level lawn but when we were there it rained the days before so the lawn was not suitable. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Place in the mountains
description: Big field where a lot of cars can park. Nice view. You can be seen from the road but only 2 cars passed. 3G signal with t-mobile. We wanted to drive from Moglice to Gjerbes but it was not possible. The road becomes worse and worse after this spot and about 5km it ended for us on a muddy uphill track where we had no chance. Maybe it is possible when it is dry. So we had to turn and sleep here.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source. There are at least two more spots on the way uphill to Tomorrit NP.

name: Place at the lake
description: This is the point where you leave the road to the right when coming from Bellaban and follow the way for about 700 meters to the lake. There are several spots where you can park. We drove the whole track over the dam and parked at the end of it. Completely quite and far away from everything. Only one shepherd was around and a local on his motorbike drove by (no idea where he came from and where he went ;-)) When it rains the way down to the lake can become very tricky with two sharp washed out curves and a lot of mud. We would not recommend it when it rained or when it looks like rain. Maybe then you can not drive back uphill till the way is dry again. When it is dry, no problem. Only 4x4. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Place at the river
description: Nice overnight place at the river and rapids. It is next to a road but not much traffic. When you are allone you can hide a bit when you drive forward where the tracking trail starts. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Natyra Camping Podgorce
description:
Nice campsite on grass close to a restaurant. The place is in the backcountry, so quiet. Owners speak good english and you can eat there, too. 

Price was 1300 lek for a camper and two people.

name: On the way from Kuç to Guzmar
description: Beautiful surroundings, very quiet (except for sheep, horses and cows) amongst the mountains. If you're coming from Kuç, it's 4x4 only. Awesome route through a riverbed. From Guzmar, possible for all cars.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can refill drinking water out of a natural source.

name: Carpark at the end of road
description:
It is a little carpark at the very end of the sealed road near a hotel/restaurant and close to the river.
It was ok to stay here in offseason. Really nice place with great views. 
Would be nice to spend some money in the restaurant. 
There are supposed to be more spots further up a gravel track.
There is wifi from the restaurant. We did not try it.

name: Drinking water
description: Out of a natural source. In the wall of a Bar / Restaurant.

name: litlle gravel space at ferry port
description:
There is a little space on the gravel for two or three campers right at the port of the alpine ferry.
Was a quiet night. Bar with water tap nearby.
Good for a night to wait for the ferry.

name: Border Albania - Greece
description: We were not allowed to cross the border with our vehicle. If we understood the officer correctly (no English) it is only allowed for Greeks and only by walking, no cars. But the drive to the border is nice though.

name: Mount Tomorr viewpoint
description: At the top of a small path at the SH71. Space for about 3 cars (levellers needed). Excellent views of surroundings and mount Tomorr. Invisible from the road.

name: campspot in the olive trees
description:
Rare flat place on the slope from the the road to the sea with olive trees. Steep and hard to find access road. No problem with our T5 front wheel drive. There is a little carpark next to the road, where the track goes down. 
levelled place for a few cars or vans. 
Some trash around. Beautiful little beach down at the water.
Bar with water nearby.

name: Camping near Beach
description:
Very beautiful small beach with difficult access. From Jale, doable in 2WD with high clearance.
We did not try the last 50m to the beach with our regular T5 but could also stay there.
From Jale follow the track southeast along the coast, pass kind of an awful rubbish dump and you are there.
There is also a 4WD track coming from Spille. 
The beach was clean without amenities. A few locals passed in their jeeps.
Please keep it clean!!!

name: beach view parking
description: follow road down, signs for beach. we paid 200 lek for 1 night (1 van, 2 ppl). no facilities, overlooking beach. restaurant/bar played music until 11pm on a weeknight, otherwise unbothered by people. during the day, locals will park there for beach access

name: River Camp beside the frogs
description:
Rivercamp easy eccassable with 2wd on the shore of the beautiful river. It is a turnoff from sh75 east of the bridge. Follow the gravel track for about 250m. There is a little crossing where you have to turn and go backwarts to the river.
Space for 1 or max 2 vehicles. Not to large vehicles for turning. Our VW, T5 was perfect. 2wd is fine.
Hardly visible from the road, although you can hear traffic noise. Lot of frog noise. 😉

name: ERI Service Station
description:
€ 10 camping at a service station on the “highway“. You even have electricity and water and a toilet. Also a restaurant at the place.  Not nice and noisy because of the street and the truck garage but ok for an overnight stay between Shkodra and Tirana. 4G signal with t-mobile.
amper spot service ( € 10 ) by ERI, 5 special assigned camper park spots with water, electric and sewer connection. Spots in the back, well separated from coming and going fuel customers. Pretty quiet for a 24-hour gas station. Even for bikers a bit of grass to pitch a tent. Not that strong, but free WiFi also available.

name: Mechanic for cars and trucks
description: Because the Toyota dealer in Tirana was too busy we bought our spare part there and ended at this big garage behind the Eri fuel station. They repair any kind of vehicle. They did a great job and even didn't want any money for 2 hours work. Highly recommended (also if we had to pay ;-))

name: Wild camping
description: Ok place for an overnight stay as there are not a lot of options along this road. It is a big lawn next to the road. Not much traffic so really quite especially at night. No shade. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source.

name: Wild camping
description: Big lawn by the river. Suitable for any kind of vehicle. The only downside: it is directly on the road so visible from it. Ok for an overnight stay from / to Vermosh  as there are not a lot of options in this area.

name: wildcamp near a pass
description: Good place for a night even for big rigs ir a couple of vehicles. It is not completely hidden from the road but there was no traffic at night. No water around.

name: Tushemisht Border (Albania)
description: Small border crossing from Albania to Macedonia.  The road  surface from Tushemist out to the border is very poor.  They DO NOT (at time of writing June '19) have the facility to provide Frontier Insurance for motorcyclists (I'm a British Citizen with British passport on a UK regtistered bike) who aren't covered by, and able to produce, a Green Card.  I was turned away and had to travel anti-clockwise, which is beautufl scenery, back up to Kjafasan border which is about 21 miles.

name: Small patch of trees opposite of dictators dacha
description:
Opposite the main entrance of the dacha of the former dictator is a patch of grass with pine-trees.
Plenty of space and due to the security-guard of the dacha, probably very safe.
It is not quiet or relaxed ad it is near the city, the beach and the road.

Good place to stop before crossing the Macedonia border.

name: Overnight stay
description: Not a pretty place but ok for an overnight stay before you take the ferry on the next morning. Flat gravel place for any kind of vehicle. You are not visible from the road but you could be seen from the parking lot of the ferry uphill. Next to a small river. No shade. 3G signal with t-mobile.

name: Nasty border control Macedonia
description:
Macedonian customs refused to let us enter because we did not have the original green-card.
We had a print, a scan in the phone and the email from the EU insurance-company. 
But no... must have original. That we come from "out of EU" did not matter.

To top it of, they did not let us turn, but forced us to drive backwards out if the border-area. In a big camper. How nice.

name: ferry to italy
description: From here you can ship your car to Italy. We went to Bari for 184 euro with GNV, 2 people with camper with cabinet. They said it was not possible to sleep in the car. 8 hour night ferry. We bought the ticket a few hours before departure. We looked online but it was 100 euro more expensive... Ticket office open at 17h, boarding from 19h30 for the ferry of 22h.

name: Riparine Mekanike
description:
Aluminium welder, he does not speak English, but is easy to deal with. 
Great welder. 
He doesn’t do steel. Ignore the comment about not doing aluminium. I made a mistake and can’t work out how to correct it.

name: NEASDEN BEACH BAR
description:
nice place we have site for the tent 
4€ 
waterfront  , bar . bathroom. , shower 
WiFi

name: Hasta la Vista Hostel
description:
Great hostel, near to the city center, and supermarkets. Very clean, comfort, A/C, nice kitchen and really friendly staff. 

Very important for mototravelers: Have a big safe and garage under ground!

name: Kruje Camping
description: Small camping, nice owner. Sanitary is old, but works. Owner speaks English very well and is very helpfull and friendly. They serve homemade pizza.

name: Wildcamping with lake view
description: Wildcamping with lake view in the Dajti Mountain Nt. Park. According to our guidebook wildcamping in Albanien parks is permited. From the lake there is a steep winding track leading to some nice flat places. The track might be a problem for big rigs and 2WD vehicles. Trecking and rock climbing is possible. Swimming in the lake is prohibited. Due to some construction work on the road from Tirane to the lake you can only drive up and down the road every 2.5hours for 30min and during the night (see picture).

name: Camping Zorgji
description: Campsite in Theth surrounded by the mountains. Basic facilities, but the place and views are stunning. Can only get there by 4x4 or foot, but that’s for the whole Theth area. A 25km dirt road leads to Theth. Many hiking trails start from Theth. Be sure you have enough money, fuel and food with you. Only a mini market with soms basic stuff and serveral guesthouses (with camping) and simple restaurants.

name: Shkoder and river
description:
Nice place next to the river and really close to the city.
Nice view on the citadel at the sunset
Quiet at night but mosque was singing during evening and you can heard a bit the main road !
Can take a bath in the river, really fresh and clear.
It's beginning of high season but we seen anybody...

name: Lagoon Camping
description: The Beach at Divjaka is crowded, but clean. Cars are not allowed at the beachfront anymore. To stay for your own, you have to go here.

name: Collomboc Prespa Lake
description:
Place of fishing boats at the water's edge.

Lieu d'embarcation des pêcheurs au bord de l'eau.

name: Korce Gymnase
description:
Drinking water front sports fields.

Eau potable devant le gymnase.

name: Lakeside
description:
Between the camping ground and the Ressort Hotel, on the waterfront opposite Macedonia.
......
Entre camping et Ressort Hôtel au bord de l'eau en face Macedoine.

name: Dajti Camping
description:
A Super camping spot nearby to Tirana
The campsite owner is very friendly! 
He offers you a welcome Raki
The campground is small but very nice to stand here for a few nights. 
The driveway is steep

name: Water Fountain - drinkable
description: the fountain works also in summer. water is drinkable.

name: Guest house Tomorri
description: Nice guest house for up to 6 persons. Ideally located to visit Berat and its castle by feet.Balcony with Shade, laundry machine, parking lot! Very friendly owners. Excellent breakfast. Ideally for a stopover after a 4wd trip on the mountain as you can wash cloth and park even a large car or van really close.

name: River Beach
description:
Beneath a suspension bridge at a road curve. A very short but steep and rocky drive from the road. Need of 4x4 and high clearance which you need any way for the drive on this road between Theth and Skhoder.
Very beautiful spot right at the river.

name: Black Drina River
description:
Right at the river at a big flat stony grassy area. Close to the bridge. Need of 4x4 to get down. Steep and rocky but short path.
Quiet but visible from road. Very little traffic though.

name: Thane Lakeside
description:
A grassy site on the shore of the lake. Very quiet and enough space for a couple of cars.  we camped with three vehicles and tents. The water is clear, and one can find small turtles there.  Relatively clean, as the only rubbish is what is washed ashore.  We cleaned up a bag or two.
Access with 4x4 only recommended from SH68.

name: Riverside Camping
description: Nice campground. 10 min. walk to the old city center and 30 min. to the Citadel. Very friendly owner. Nice terrace where you can sit in the shadow.

name: Thethi National Park Mount Maja Shtegut
description: Small flat campsite for 2-3 smaller 4x4‘s, sadly there is a bit of rubbish lying around in the woods but for a few days a good spot to rest or start hiking tours.There is enough firewood in the forest and already built campfire places.

name: Laguna
description:
Small campsite at the end of the road. 5€ truck and 2 people.

Petit camping g a la fin de la route 5€ camion et 2 pers.

name: Koman school
description:
In front of the school, a place where there is shade from 2PM. Good while waiting for the boat to Fierse the day after.

devant l'école un endroit où il y a de l'ombre a partir de 14 h bon en attendant le bateau du lendemain

name: Dragova
description:
Field in a beautiful small village, where lavender fights in the middle of a hamlet. Nice people, they offered water view.

sur une la place ou se bat la lavande au milieu d'un hameau gens sympas ont offert de l'eau belle vue.

name: Skadar Lake
description:
At the edge of the lake, 6 km from the customs in the middle of the birds. Near a restaurant, invited by the owner.

Au bord du lac a 6 km de la douane au milieu des oiseaux près d'un restaurant invité par le proprio paraît.

name: mosaic home
description:
pretty new hostel( May 2019) with friendly staff and free delicious breakfast. There are 10 mixed dorm, 4 mixed dorm and 4 female dorm @ 10Euro pp.
Spacious kitchen n garden with parking space but not for big bike like ours. 
location is walking distance to city centre. 
comfortable bed and shared shower areas even 3- bed private room.

name: Jali Camping
description: Nice Camping direct on the beach very friendly owner. Good restaurants on the beach...

name: Valbonariver
description: It is a very nice place to stay and swim in the Vabona River. It is the bathing place of very friendly Albanian youth.

name: Place to crash for the night
description: This place could be an option if you don’t have 4wd and can’t reach the 4wd spot at the lake (we didn’t even try it). It is not a very good spot. There are trees for shade. It is right at a small gravel road. There were two people walking by in the evening and some workers driving by in the morning. If you find a good place somewhere in the area, don’t use this spot. You might consider deleting this spot in this case. You can find some sharp tree things on the ground but it is not too bad.

name: road condition information
description:
We were not sure about the road conditions past Poliçan heading south. You might have the same problems so we let you know what we know.
The road from Berat gets rebuilt right now but is driveable for any vehicle without problems.
The road to Rog and Çepan is paved and most of the time very good to drive. It passes the ‚The bride’s hole‘ and the wildcamping spot ‚Camping close to footbridge‘. 
We wanted to get to Përmet on the SH75 in the south and turned from the paved road to the wildcamping spot ‚nice spot next to river‘. The gravel road was okay until the wildcamping spot ‚Riverbed Malind‘. After that it was quite rough for our 2wd Skoda Fabia. We turned around at the beautiful wildcamping spot ‚nice spot next to river‘ where we slept. 
We thought that the big paved road goes to Përmet but this is not the case. You have to take the small one passing the two wildcamping spots. It seems to be about 12kms from the wildcamping spot where we slept to a bigger gravel road and 4.5kms to the wildcamping spot from the big paved road. If we would have known this before we got back to the big paved road we would have tried it.

name: Nice and cheap pizza
description: We had nice pizzas and a beer here. A pizza is 300Lek (2.50€). It tastes very good. You can seat under trees in the shade. It is opposite of the bus stop.

name: Riverbed close to Shulbater
description: It’s a pretty flat gravel area along Mat river with a bit of goat poop. But where not ;) We spend a quiet night with some bats flying around and a big herd goats passing by in the morning. It’s not far from the main road SH6 close to a iron bridge. The way down is a little steep and 4x4 recommend. Better check before you drive down due riverbeds can be different after each rain.

name: great view
description: Meadow on 2 levels next to the road. Almost no traffic, so no problem. We spent a nice afternoon and a quiet night here. View of the mountains and in the valley. Great. Not for big rigs, as the road has height restrictions.

name: Drin river view
description: Beautiful and quiet spot with great view. Some friendly shepards are walking by in the evening and morning. Not for big rigs, as the entry to the place is narrow (entry is after a bend on route SH23). Hard to find an almost even spot.

name: View of the plane
description: Great place with great view. Very quiet. The street is visible, but on that (gravel) road almost no traffic. You need high clearance and maybe 4x4 for that route - it is a scenic and beautiful route!

name: Family camp
description:
A super nice, cosy, basic campsite. Beautifully located between the mountains. It’s run by a very friendly couple Donna and Robbert. Donna speaks English well and gives you a warm welcome.

The campsite is not too big, just a few nice spots for your camper/car/tent. Animals (dogs, sheeps) walk near your camp :) The facilities are basic (standing toilet) but a nice warm shower and they keep it clean. In the front they’ve build a small cosy bar where you can have a drink.

We payed 8 euro’s for a night; 2 persons and a car. It’s def a place to recommend if you are searching for a beautiful back to basic (no wifi) warm welcome spot! (We received a drink when we arrived and tea in the morning)

name: Dorcas Relief & Development
description: Dorcas is an international NGO Organisation. They let you stay on the compound for 12 Euros incl. electricity. You can use the washing Maschine for free. They are very friendly and give you a lot of information incl. city map. There is a 24hour guard, very nice guys. The place is walking distance to the old Town, you walk along the park, the Bulevard Republik to the cathedral/Bazar (really worth a visit). Very easy and chilled 3kms. There are toilets, hot showers (very nice!), a sink to do the dishes, theoretically wifi (did not work when we were there, but we did not bother asking to reset). There also is a grassy area to put your car, but be aware of dog crap, we decided to stay on the concrete. It's situated at the ring road, so you have traffic noise, normal for a city. And of course dogs barking. Shops, bakery just 2 minutes walking away.

name: The English Hostel
description: Nice hostel run by an American guy. Access to full kitchen, free use of the washing machine, a proper shower and breakfast included. I paid 800leks (6euros) for a bed in dorm in October 2019. Very quiet neighborhood and close to city center. Cyclist friendly!

name: Wildcamp 15 miles(ish) from Lake Komani
description: Very quiet camp spot with beautiful views. A good spot if you’re heading to Lake Komani. Good for one night. Rocky ground, but we managed to peg our tent in. Little scramble to get there, but we managed with 6 panniers and 2 bikes.

name: Wild campsite
description: Place is a very rural campsite with nearly no facilities. A dumb toilet and running cold water. Bring everything you need. Just accessible by 4x4, it’s like a 1h drive from Theth. Nobody around, what a place. Paid 3€, to a guy who did some work, but he left in the evening. If you want to hike Mount Jeserce you are saving already two hours walking from Theth.

name: Divjakë
description: Quet and peaceful place near beach. To the Norh and over the small bridge only beach bars and young folk crossing around.

name: Mechanics and parts
description: A couple of car mechanics and a big car parts store are all on this little square. Lots of 4x4 parts in stock. Mechanics are used to work on Land Rovers and Land cruisers. We went to the mechanic left of the little coffee shop. About 2500 lek for 2 hours of work.

name: Joni Hotel and bar and ristorante
description: Very nice place to stay. Friendly for bikers, you can just hide the bike behind the building. Good hone made food, owners are teally helpful and open for tourists.  We paid 12 Wuro per night with breakfast after seassn in November. Beautiful view from the room - on the Ohrid lake. Worth that. Fast wifi.

name: On the top
description: Field next to the main road. Splendid view.  Some small trees.

name: Hill top meadow
description: Easy access if not wet. On the other side of the hill from the parking lot your can access a little track that had some for pits and some level ground for vans or anything more capable. Probably not for larger motorhomes. Definately walk it first but it was no problem with a LWB sprinter 2wd. Lots of tent space etc.

name: Hostel Durres
description:
nice hostel overall. nice staff and nice breakfast in the morning.
secure parking for one maybe 2 motorcycles right in the city center. 
heating was provided in winter. only bathrooms were a bit cold. Fee was 8 euros per night.

name: exchange currency nova
description:
i got an incredible exchange rate here. 
basically almost better than the official rate. 
not sure if it s even possible.
changed €20 and got 2500lek which was even better than the google exchange rate (2469lek).
anyway...

name: cioccolati italiani free wifi
description:
kind of a weird open air mall with wifi. 
next door there is all trash and abandoned buildings.
why.

name: Maya Hostel Berat
description:
pretty cool and super clean Hostel, right in front of the old town. there s a cute and friendly dog welcoming guests and the host is great too. his mom prepares breakfast.
the whole place has a familiar vibe and a very friendly atmosphere.
parking for motorcycle inside.
paid €9 in a 4beds dorm with ensuite and breakfast.
beers are 120lek. 
perfect stay.

name: mondi's fast food
description:
Actually a pretty nice bakery with local products.
very cheap and perfect for a snack on the go.
100 lek for pretty much any of the nice pastries you can get here.

name: Paid Overnight Parking
description: Very close to the beach, paved parking. It seems the parking belongs to the bar/restaurant Sunset. No worries, while you park your rig, somebody will show up and welcome you. You don't have to visit the bar/resto. Pay € 5 for the night direct or later. Friendly guy. There is a separate restroom outside the resto. Very quiet. You basically only hear the sea.

name: Lake Ohrid wild spot
description: Beautiful spot on lake Ohrid. Not much trash, nice beach and some shade. Pass the resort and after 300 meters the spot is on the left. We didn’t pay anything. During the day some locals come to enjoy the beach and picnic. Quite at night.

name: Restaurant GESI
description:
There are many restaurants around but we chose GESI as it was crowded by many locals. You can sit in separee‘s on the water.
We had two main dishes (Grilled Eel and Grilled Shrimps), Risotto, Bread with vegetables and cheese, mixed salad and two Beer. The Food was delicious!
We payed around 30€ for our best meal in Albania so far.

name: Lake view close to border
description:
Close to the Albanian - Greek border overlooking an artificial lake. Google maps doesn't show this road but there is a little road from the village to the lake, continue over bridge and take the off path on the right up to the hill. 

Great views and hardly any traffic. Jorgos the Sheppard is a great man and passes by a couple of times per day. No speak English but hands and body language go a long way

name: Albanica Winery
description: Albanica Winery in the middle of winyards with a fantastic view. Nice restaurant with little shop where you can buy wine and olive oil from own production and have organic homemade food. Very nice owner speaks perfect English. From the village Kolonjë Ardenice drive up the hill to the monastary church until you see the signs to Albanica Winery and from there follow the gravel road.

name: Ferma Grand Albanik
description:
A family farm in the middle of the wild nature, sorrounded by forests and wide fields. They have 3 family rooms with 4, 5 and 6 beds builded in wood and stone. There is also a small restorant with bilogical farmer traditional food. A bio-boutique with jams, honey and different herbal teas is situated inside the farm. A camping aerea serving to camping cars and vans but also for campers. A lot of activities in nature are suggested by the staff wich is all women. 
We went there with our camper van when it became to hot on the beaches. Up there it cools down in the evening and you can enjoy a glas of wine on the patio with a nice view to the sorrounding nature. The whole environment is very calm and relaxing. 
The last 3 km are gravel road but easy for any vehicle. Just follow the signs to the Farm Hotel and Camping.
Good Vodafone 4G connection.

name: Parking
description:
This is a beach parking. It is free of charge. Right at the beach! There are plenty of restaurantes around.
It was acesseble for our 7,2 m Truck

name: Fish House
description: Simple camping. Familiar. Sea view. 10 meters to the sea. Good fish restaurant.

name: Aquarium Beach
description: Take the road from Jale. First you enter a nice beach with big stones, drive further (only accessible for cars with high clearance and good four wheel drive). After 300m you can go right up the hill. And after a smal rock section you’re arrived on paradise! Beautiful private beach and panoramic views from the camp spot. There’s a smal walking path down to the beach very easy doable.

name: Belinis Bar, Restaurant Hotel Camping
description: When entering Theth and going over the bridge turn left and follow the river upwards. Around 500 meters up There is a small Path to the right. We went up with our truck 250 wide, 400 high and 750 long. It's run by 2 brothers. Very friendly, we stood for free... Cheap beer, WiFi, etc etc I don't know What they normally charge. But they have a restaurant, sleeping facilities ec

name: Bicycle shop
description: This was the best shop for accessories we found in this bicycle street. Pretty crappy street not many shops lots of them nothing useful but this is Albania so things are scarce. Speaks English.

name: Riverbed
description: Amazing spot for wildcamping in/near the riverbed. Only suited for small vehicles with a rooftoptent or a small tent. We were able to cross the riverbed, but you can also take the bridge and make a right turn in the hairpin. We camped in the middle of the road, as no-one seems to use it. A shepherd came by and was totally fine with us staying here. Plenty of firewood around.

name: Servis Auto Gjekaj
description:
Big service centre for Mercedes, but they also do Land Rover, Volkswagen, BMW and some Fiats. 

We came here for a distributor cap for our Jeep (long shot) which didn't work out, but the guys are friendly and speak English.

In the end they even helped us getting some materials to improve our repair.

name: Abandoned bee farm
description:
Wild camping approximately 30 minutes from the ferry (13 km). Steep gravel road, 4x4 needed. Not suitable for big rigs. Not entirely hidden from the road, but far enough to not be disturbed.

The road leads to an abandoned bee farm. A few options for camping with a rooftoptent or campervan as the ground is rocky and uneven. You might be able to pitch a tent.

name: Wildcamp beside the Vjosa river
description: Beautifull spot. You can stand right beside the Vjosa river on the gravel bed, if there is litte water like in september. Or you can park your car under some trees few meters from the river bed. 4x4 is usefull but not necessary.

name: Himara Camping
description:
Our facilities include toilets, showers, 24/7 water and electricity. Tents are available to rent (or you can bring your own). We also have a small restaurant with fresh local food cooked in the typical Albanian way and a bar with lots and lots of raki!

Himara Camping is embedded in an olive groove surrounded by a white stone fence. Every one of our 100 pitches has its own tree. The campsite covers an area of 10,000m^2 for tents, campers, bikers and caravans. We offer magical scenery, excellent local hospitality and competitive prices in order to give you an unforgettable holiday.

Himara Camping is situated above Livadh Beach (25m high), next to Himara, the heart of Albanian Riviera. It is just 5min drive from the center of the city where post office, banks and bus station are situated. It is only 15min drive to Ali Pashas fortress, in Porto Palermo and 20min walking distance from Himaras castle, that you can also see from the camping area.

Due to the climate, Himara Camping operates only during the summer season (May-September). Himara is a central town on the Southern Albanian coast, and can be used as the base point for a range of remarkable excursions.

We offer excursions and tours to a variety of places every few days.

name: By the old bridge
description: Nice spot by the old bridge. A bit of a short steep gravel hill to negotiate, but should be fine for any vehicle.

name: Sotira's Waterfall
description: A beautiful waterfall for exploring, swimming, and fresh water drinking. We also camped here on a flat, grassy, field right next to the falls. A beautiful area of Albania! The road to Berat from here was a bit tricky due to the mud and grooves.

name: Side of the road
description: Relatively level grassy spot off the side of a very quiet but paved road.

name: Abandoned Ruins
description: This is a seclude area at an abandoned foundation near a paved road and a livestock watering hole. We parked out two motorcycles and camped behind the ruins of a stone wall. It was quiet except for the sounds of frogs from the nearby pond. A local goat herder came by and didn’t seem to care that we were camping for the night.

name: Clandestino Camping
description: Quiet informal rural camping.  Ideal for a relaxing stay.

name: Salca Cem
description: Nice, clean location right off the road.

name: Albania
description:
No Name  - but shows on Maps.me. First and second floors have a "common" room, surrounded by 3 bedrooms with two twin beds in each room. common toilet and shower, places to safely store bicycles.
800 lek per person (about 7 Euro). No wifi.

name: Cafe/Bar
description: Cafe/bar also serves food. Very large portions. There is a covered patio in rhe back where they let us sleep.

name: Cafe/bar - food
description: This cafe/bar/restaurant has a sheltered area behind the bar for 2 to 4 folks to sleep. They close up the place at 9:00 pm, and it is quiet.

name: Parking just outside Dardhe
description: Nice level spot for any size rig just outside the village. Nice strong Vodafone signal.

name: Restaurant Ali Pasha
description: Parking of Restaurant Ali Pasha on the way between Tepelenë and Fier. Short distant to the main road so it is quiet. We paid 5€ for one night, wifi and toilets (bit old but clean) included.

name: Nice cafe
description: Really modern and nice cafe place with car wash

name: Near Tamare
description: Nice level spot just off the road suitable for any size rig. Fantastic mountain views.

name: Water point
description:
Water spring next to the track.
Easy to stop without blocking the way.

name: Vloré beach
description: Nice place to be, under the tree, near the beach, and some beach restaurants. Some trash.

name: Lake Shkoder
description:
On our way to Montenegro, on SH 25 Road.
We found some little spots to park the car. Beside the road that heads to Zogaj. It's almost at the border.
Only little cars or campers or small Van's. No places for big rigs. Perfect for ground tents, for motorcycle overlanders and rooftents like us.
Not such level ground. You have to find a good place or use some stones to put your car in a good position.

name: Zvernec Beach near Kalaja Ruins
description:
Very nice place with shade and 10 meters from the sea. Sadly, lots of garbage around. Several camping spots for vans, cars or even big rigs. Quiet and perfect to stay as long as you wish. 300 meters away there is a restaurant where you can order some food and ask for water. 
We stayed one night before our crossing to Italy through Vlora Port by ferry. But as we could not cross to Italy, requiring 10 more days of quarantine because of Covid, we passed more 3 nights here. Perfect. 
Some nice dogs came around and we shared our food with them.
Have fun, and keep the place clean. If you can pickup some garbage and disposal it in the next trashcan like we did. Perfect sunsets.

name: Hilltop
description:
Top of the hill before Butrint.  Nice flat spots in the middle of olive trees. You enter a small dirt road just beside the parking lot on the street.
Nice view of the ocean and the channel, with the bay. It was a rainy day so we could not do some of the trekking trails around.
There are some pit fire places that people use.

name: Borsh Beach
description:
Many little bars and houses just at the shore. All of them seemed abandoned. We chose a flat spot near one of them and parked our car.
Made our food and slept here in our rooftop tent. Only a shepherd and his lambs and dogs came around.The police passed by and didn't even look at us.
Sadly the weather was rainy and windy so we didn't have so much fun in the beautiful and green water from the beach.

name: Vlore Port
description:
You can buy your tickets online or direct at one of the several shipping companies at the main entrance of the Port. All of them have the same prices.
Choose the date and hour. Better buy here at the desk. If you need to change something it's easier.
We bought by internet and had some problems to change schedule because of Covid.

name: wild camp park/camp under olive trees
description:
Nice pull-in off road under olive trees.
coming down the hill pull in to right and go up  100 m and around to a flat spot,you'll see a couple of lovely flat  spots under olive trees.Some nice views too.
Hidden from main road.The main road is.desd quiet at night.
Can't guarantee it will suit you but definitely worth a look if it's late and you're tired and need a spot for the night.I had a nice night.I also had a nice subset!

name: Next to old ruined house
description:
Pick your spot! Nice grassy areas.
By the old ruined house 650 m down the rocky road  from the the Resort and Pass.
Fresh water stream nearby and fire pits.
I camped at the side of the house kinda hidden from the road.
Note: these last few Kms to the top/ resort/pass are very rocky and rough.
4x4 only and there's little deviation where the road got washed out.

name: Old ruined house on bend,with flat parking/camping
description:
After a hard day on my bike from Burrel I came down and pulled in here.Lovely flat grassy spot.Camped on the grass. Loads of space.
1 local on a horse, who wished me a nice night, and couple of cars passed.Friendly.
None after 7pm.Very quiet.

name: Turn off on headland bend
description:
Turn off here on the bend by the electronic tower and pick your spot.
At the bend area is ok but if you want a quieter place follow the track down 200m or so.
I had a quiet night away from the road,even though the road is quiet.
The 2 other places along this road on ioverlander were not an option for me and really not ideal places.I looked at them first coming from the Koman ferry but they weren't practical.

Note:
Next morning ,I went about 4 Kms to the long bridge towards Shkoder, and saw a camper/truck just off the road on a gavel track leading to village of Gomsiqe, near the bridge parked about 200 m in. Seemed perfect even if visible.Plenty of pine trees in this area.
Some houses behind them but didn't care.
Plenty of flat ground around the bridge.Definitely a good spot!

name: Mi Casa Es Tu Casa Hostel
description:
Amazing central hostel with plenty of bikes/motorbikes spaces,garden and a few spaces outside on a back street for a van or bike.
When full in summer I believe she will let people camp too or hammock out back.
Really friendly owners and volunteers who fosters dogs.They're will likely be a puppy or 2 wandering around.They bark but are quiet at night I slept very well here,best full equipped kitchen I've seen in a hostel for ages.Hot showers etc..a real home away from home.They have a bar but 10pm quiet rules apply.
I booked via Booking.com €7 for a dorm.

name: Tirana backpackers hostel
description:
Wonderful place where you can spend your tiranian holidays. It’s a kind of old villa, quite big, good vibes, nice backyard, very clean, and place for your motorcycles inside 

Ilir (the manager, kinda of hippy super nice)
00355683133451

Price 9/10€ in dormitory

name: Wild Camping
description: Very nice place on the seaside. Just a few campers are here.

name: Beach by river
description:
Best entrypoint: 40.46143 19.23017
A Place (only little Camper and Vans 2wd ok better 4x4 ) between a little River and a Forest, near a Beach. Sand, drivable  with 2wd.  best Places only 4x4.

name: Riverside
description:
A big area with flat places to park. 
Entry by the River. Nice view of the Mountains and River.
4x4 only

name: Supermarkt Europa
description: Free WIFI Access at Supermarkt Europa at the parking space.

name: Near river
description:
Small place under tree‘s between two little dirt roads. Only saw 2 people fishing, 20 Meters to the River, 4 minutes walking to the beach. 
Some shade, at the end of the dirt road along the River is a little sand beach. 
A lot of fish, crabs, and turtles.
A lot of other places around here. Not big but quiet and nice.

name: Ledi’s place (Free)
description:
Beautiful farm perched on top of a hill. Amazing views on the lake, delicious food and friendly people who treat you like family.

Camping is for free on their property. Level ground. I stayed here 3 days, great times.

They fish, grow olives/veggies and make cheese. Very affordable prices (5-10€ per big meal). 

Fast Wi-Fi (30 Mbit/s), available free toilets and warm shower. Perfect place!

name: Coin Laundry - lajthaj
description:
Cheap, clean coin laundry. 

200 Leke = 10kg wash
100 Leke = 10kg Dry

Bring enough coins.

name: Traditionel Slow Food  - Fisi Restaurant
description:
Fantastic local food! Also surprisingly good vegetarian options. 300-500 leke. 

Parking available.

name: Pine forest
description:
By the side if the road, pine forest with small roads going inside. Some trash, less if you venture more inside.

Camped for the night, quiet. 4G reception (One.al)

name: Roadside
description:
Free parking by the side of the road. Noisy because of the cars, but a great location to explore the city. 

Stayed here one night without issues. Nice view of the city

name: Roadside
description:
Under pine trees, by the side of the road. View of the lake. Level ground.

100m of steep dirt track from the asphalt road to get here. Plenty other spots further ahead.

name: massive field with a view
description: Right by the road towards Fierze there is a big open field overlooking the mountains. Suitable for all type of vehicles and enough space for multiple campers. The road is very quiet and the locals are friendly, with some goats checking in sometimes.

name: Beautiful view
description:
Flat space on top of a hill, close to a road. The road is gravel, and used to go to the beach. Busy during the day, desert and quiet at night. Best views of the sunset and the glimmering lights of Sarande in the distance. 

Road there is unpaved and bumpy, but doable with 2WD. Space for 2 motorhomes.

name: Intermed Laboratory
description: Laboratory to take a covid19 PCR test for travellers. It cost 6000 lek/ 50€. I was there at 11:30 am and the test came per email at 7pm the same day.

name: Jungle Camping
description:
it's a really nice and quiet place operated by two polish guys, Kuba and Philip. To get here, put Hotel Elizabet to the GPS then follow along the gravel road on the coast. Reachable by 2WD.
Provides potable water, WiFi, fridge and electricity.
you can also cook here if you don't have your own kit

name: Kepi i Rodonit
description: Ardeni campsite. We paid around 11 eur, nice place to camp near the beach in what it looks like an established facility for turists. But it did not have any toilets, showers or wather source. It is basicaly wild camping, but you pay 11 eur. At night the beach and the campsite was all ours.

name: field opposite to the parking lot
description: we wanted to have a more private parking and the parking was already hosting several campers, so we went down from the road to the other direction. no one bothered us and we were the only ones there

name: Rruga Peshkopi-Makelkare Shkopet Lake
description:
A restaurant with camping space on the lakeshore. A beautiful place where you are allowed to stay overnight. Water and bathroom available.
No wifi. E5 per night, but free if you dine in the restaurant. Good value restaurant, nice food.
Un restaurante con espacio para acampar a orillas del lago Shkopet. Es un lugar precioso y te permiten pasar la noche.  
Hay agua y un baño.  
No hay wifi.
5€ la noche, pero si cenas en el restaurante, no te lo cobran.
El restaurante es económico y se come muy bien.

name: Bruno Service
description:
Motor bike repair Bruno Service. 
Repairs all kind of bikes and scooters. Milling machine for mechanical repairs. 
Phone 0694719068.

name: Hola Slot Canyon
description:
Spectacular slot canyon. You can hike around 2 km into the canyon. Some warmish water pools on the way to warm hour feet. Restaurants at the entrance where you can camp (tent, car...). 2WD access. 
Some cave 10 km up the road. Did not go but local guy turned around as he only had 2WD.

name: Moto Bero
description: Great bike parts and repair shop. Had a battery for my Transalp on stock I could not find in Macedonia and organized me a new regulator from Tirana in half a day. Lots of parts on stock. Also sell choose bikes and rebuild old Yamahas.  Phone +355695144439. English spoken.

name: Doka Expedition on the beach
description:
Empty sandy beach. No tourists, no people, no cars - only us in the beach.
 Only 4x4 cars. 
 30km from Shkoder, 2,5km from Baks-Rrjolle.

name: Meadow grounds next to Shishtavec
description: We stayed here the night with 4 bikes and 2 jeeps. There are several places with flat grass grounds and a small stream. The nearby village also has a market and Cafe. People are very friendly and curious. Someone from the locals came by later and said hello and happily got a beer from us. 4wd/high clearance is recommended since the descent road from the village is pretty steep and Rocky.
