Watch for soft spots/mud in the grass.

name: Mizeri Guesthouse
description: Lovely guesthouse run by an even lovelier family. Very quiet and peaceful, clean and well kept. Motorbike parking in the patio, cars can park 25 m down the street.  Narrow and steep streets probably hard for large campers.

name: Beside track
description: We didn't camp here ourselves but on our way from Gjerbes to Corovoda on TET Albania we came across this place next to the track. The main road is unpaved already so only 4x4 or motorcycle recommended. There is almost no traffic on this road and if you go 50 meters further you can't be seen from the road. There are enough spots for tents and campers. Please leave the area clean.

name: Camping Lekdush
description: Family run camping with a small restaurant on site. They offer straw huts for 30e but we could pitch our own tent with 2 motorcycles for 10e total. Even if you are with camper they have ample space so you can find a spot. Might need levelers though.

name: Near river
description:
At the beginning of Borsh beach. About 300 meters of stony beach where you can camp by the sea.

There is a small river that flows into the sea that provides fresh water!

Then there are a couple of bars closer to the main area of the beach that should be about 3 km long, but far enough away to be calm.

Al comienzo de la playa de Borsh. Unos 300 metros de playa pedregosa donde acampar al la del mar.

Hay un pequeño rio que desemboca en el mar que proporciona agua dulce!

Luego hay un par de bares más próximos a la zona principal de la playa que debe tener unos 3 km, pero a la suficiente distancia para estar tranquilos.

name: la onda beach bar
description:
Near the beach on a Restaurant Parking.
10 € for the night(Camper with 2 p).no elektricity.but shower and toilets

name: Mali Camping
description: Nice campsite with olive trees managed by a sympathic German couple. Good hot shower, clean toilets. Restaurant (Wifi) with good food short path up hill.

name: Restaurant 300
description: This meal was a dream. We had wafer-thin pork with potatoes in an indescribably good sauce. The chef deserves a star. That there is something like that in this area is unbelievable. English is spoken.

name: Parking for hiking
description: Very nice old couple that runs the teahouse, also allow you to park while you hike from Valbonë to Theth. We had a very good experience with them, some nice coffee and tea.

name: Restaurant/guesthouse
description: If you find yourself here after or before a hike, take a chance on this amazing restaurant. Perfect local dishes, very friendly staff and nice atmosphere. There’s also a new guesthouse opening and they are open for camping too.

name: Taverna Tradicionale
description: Authentic restaurant with Albanian cuisine! Good food for a fair price.

name: flat ground
description: flat ground,far from street. okay for one night. only with off road accessible with high clearance as you need to cross a small stream and a high ground.

name: Eco Garden Hostel (motorbike friendly)
description: Fred has a very nice little hostel with several rooms. A room for 3 people cost like 20€. He speaks German and English. They are super helpful organising trips around Albania. It’s especially good if you travel by motorbike, since you can park save just next to your room. Small 4x4 should also fit inside the premises. For bigger campervans I wouldn’t really recommend it, since the access road is quite narrow. But anyhow - another guest had his Nissan Patrol parked just in front of the hostel. City center just 5 minutes walk away.

name: Weirdo Hostel
description:
Well - today was a strange travel day. Since it was raining cats and dogs I decided to spent my last Lekë for an accommodation. Riding with my motorbike was not really funny. At the time of my visit there was three options available and I ended up staying at this place which I kind of regret in the end. 

All of them cost 10€ the night and 5€ for breakfast and 5€ for dinner. I don’t know much of the very last place at the end of the road but it was very crowded that time so I kept on searching. The second place (the very first one to the left) was nice and with a huge flat area for camper vans. Also some shady trees. Rooms are everywhere same same - simple beds for up to 5. Only downside there was the room in the second floor and since I didn’t want to carry all my wet stuff up I kept on searching. 

Now comes the weird thing. Once I told them at the place I stayed in the end that I am going to pay with my last Lekë (1500 which is even more then 10€ and another 5€, also my last cash, for the dinner) there mood changed quite to the negative. They started a huge discussion about it for minutes. At a certain moment I just didn’t care anymore and decided to take it as it is. I really didn’t see the problem.

The road itself is just mindblowing. The village is really nothing special. The view from the valley into the surrounding mountains is nice though. ;-) Try you luck with Lekë and let me kn

name: Guesthouse Mitaj
description: Probably best place in town for overlanders.

name: Duka Winery & Vineyard
description:
Vineyard with an excellent restaurant, the food and wines here are a true experience for little money compared to european standards. 

They also offer a guided tour through their vineyard and cellar. Best to make a reservation.

name: at the lake
description: small flat ground at the lake. something gets build here. space for 2 or 3 landrover. steep dirtroad.good for fishing and swimming.

name: Bujtina Lekë Gerla Guesthouse
description:
It's a guesthouse where you can camp on one big grassy field. Suitable for 7-8 Van's.  You can use toilet and shower of the guesthouse. It's also possible to eat here (breakfast/dinner), but you need to order it in advance. 
The car entrance is narrow!
The daughter speaks good English. We spend one quiet night here and paid 10 Euro (2person+van).

name: American Hospital
description:
You can do an antigen rapid test. The result ist ready in 30min and it costs 20 Euros per Person. 
Very quick and uncomplicated.
Of course you can also do a PCR Test here.

name: one night spot
description: Perfect for one night before heading further into the country. It's a quiet backroad with a few possible camp spots on the right and left, found it in the dark but still liked it in daytime. In the morning a shepherd and a guy with a tractor passed but that's it.

name: Prrenjas Climb
description:
Spot in the middle of the climb from Prrenjas.
Not the best spot ever:
- highly visible from de road 
- noise from the road
- nice view over the valley
- no wild dogs
Suitable for cyclists

name: Villa Verde (Hotel and camping)
description:
Very Nice hotel run bij husband and wife. Car/motorcycle/camper can be Parked on the property behind gate. They have two dogs who guard at night but are really friendly.
They can cook dinner at albanian prices and it tasted me really good.
Rooms are basic, but you are not in Albanië for posh luxus.
Warm water from boiler and clean bathrooms. And there is a common area with small bar and woodburner

name: Buna Park Resort
description: Just a gravel parking lot beside the river next to the restaurant in the Buna Park Resort. No services, but the reception at the hotel said we could park in our motorhome for free as long as we wished. Not secured, but video surveillance and we felt quite safe leaving the motorhome behind while we went into the city.

name: Leon Restaurant Parking
description: Just a restaurant parking lot facing the beach. Motorhomes or campers can overnight for free and use the restaurant toilets. No charge.

name: Camping and restaurant
description: The restaurant has been here for years, but in the summer of 2021 they added camping. They now have 7 electric motorhome sites, and a nice tent camping area. No shade at the motorhome sites, but lots of shade available for sitting out on the grounds. In November, we paid €10 all inclusive with electric, showers and laundry.

name: Sigma
description: We purchased motorcycle insurance here, one month for 23€. Covers Albania only.

name: Hotel
description: Hotel with nice restaurant. Hotel rooms are actually 4 single bed dorm rooms, with bathroom. It cost me 12 Euro a night.  When my wife joined me two nights later, the price was still 12 Euro for the two of us.

name: Plaza Hotel
description: Nice clean hotel in the centre of Gramsh. There is a restaurant and cafe attached with standard pricing. A double room was 3000 LEK. Street parking, possible to park Motos on the sidewalk by entrance.

name: Labs - COVID tests
description: The closest place for Greek border crossing to make corona tests. 2000 ALL for rapid test.

name: Hotel Veri
description: A little pricey at €40 a night for two people, but included breakfast and is quite nice. Free underground parking. The rooms are big and clean. The view of the mountains is superb. Restaurant on site with decent prices.

name: Hotel International
description: Decent hotel at good prices. €13 for a double room with breakfast. €18 for a king suite with jet tub and breakfast. Frank the owner is friendly, and the restaurant/cafe is nice. (Minus the thick cloud of cigarette smoke)

name: Parking space
description:
Just a small parking place close to the sea. You can hear the road and see some lights, but spend a very good night.

In the season the Restaurant maybe open, so check it out if it's still available in Summer.

name: Drinking Water Tap
description: A drinking water tap right on the Romebe Oil petrol station. Extremely friendly English-speaking staff who helped us out with an adapter for our hose. They also operate a café and a fast-food place together with a toilet which was sparkly clean!

name: Vlora puplic water fountain
description: Public drinking water fountain. The locals also fill their 5l water canisters here.

name: Llogara puplic water fountain
description: Public drinking water fountain. The locals also fill their 5l water canisters here.

name: kastel
description: quitl place near de Castle of Sarande with superb 360 panorama view over the bay and mountains. Accessible for all vehicules.Only suitable after season (we were here half march)

name: Bike Point
description: excellent and friendly bike shop, helped with route planning, box storage and advice

name: frashër
description: After coming a very streneous route from the thermal bath (Kanion Langarica) (the 33 km took us 4 hours) we found this quiet place just outside Frashër. Route only possible for real 4x4's and no longer than 6,5m and no wider than 2 .00m. In winter not possible, we crossed it by the end of March and had still some snow. Route not suitable for the fainthearted because of the small, bumpy  slippery Road along ravines sometimes. Beautiful scenery with some traditional villages. offroad lovers will love it . We travelled with a Bremach, 6.00m long.

name: ORA RV Camping
description: Nice Campground for visiting Gjirokaster. Good Restaurant, friendly staff…

name: Naza Hostel
description: Free camping on the back of the hostel. Not cramped, olive trees with shade plus a small creek and fire places. Pigs, horses and cows visiting. Spectacular!

name: Camping Fridolin
description: A fantastic family run campsite. The owner Albin speaks German and his son speaks English. Great shower and toilet facility with free use of washing machine and dryer. Cafe/bar on site with good restaurant next door. Campers, tents and bikers welcome as are large rigs. Albin also runs a garage so can help with all mechanical issues. We got our Mercedes T1 completely resprayed through a friend of Albin si fantastic service. electric and wifi on site for all as well as kitchen and communal sitting area. highly recommended

name: river camp
description:
various places along the river, there is a gravel road along it. choose your place, just be aware of where the river might go if there is a thunderstorm in the mountains behind. 
we heard dogs barking in the distance, but no one bothered us (people or dogs).
there is te usual garbage around as everywhere along the rivers, the water itself looks clean. 
Vodafone signal good and 4G.

name: Moto Teri
description: In Elbasan, father and son run this motorbike garage. They both have knowledge and didn't rip us off! Son Mikel speaks english.

name: Monastery
description: Nice quiet place in front of an old monastery. Nobody around. Great view into the valley and the mountains around.

name: At the top of a green hill
description: Wonderful place in the middle of nowhere. Great views around into the mountains. We saw bear tracks. Totally peaceful. This is the track of the Off Road Book of Pistenkuh No. N9 from Tirana to Bulquizë. We had to cut a lot of branches, but it is doable for big rigs and it is really great. See the warning about the damaged bridge further down.

name: Bridge damaged, no big rigs
description: Coming from Tirana. The Bridge was already a bit damaged, but we had no choice so we drove over. One part broke. So now we recommend to avoid the bridge with a big rig like ours. It is not possible anymore. For smaller cars it is no problem.

name: Old school
description: Beautiful place above the black drin river. Grassy and level. Next to a abandoned school. Absolutely nice place.

name: Nice, big, flat meadow
description: From Rrëshen to Van Dejës. This meadow invited us to stay. The surrounding is quite flat. You can see the mountains in the background. A beautiful place to stay overnight.

name: At the river bed
description: A really nice place, even it is near the street. But the street is not loud and there are very less cars at night. The place near the river and on the river bed is very beautiful and with great views. Be aware of the water level, because sometimes it rains in the mountains and the level increase.

name: Lake Prespa shore
description: Flat ground at the end of a dirt road. Some cows. The surface gets pretty muddy as you get close to the lake. Frogs, birds and tortoises and a beautiful view of the lake and the mountains. Nobody around except an occasional shepherd.

name: Bridge over Vjosa river
description: Pleasant meadow next to the bridge. Flat, grassy, no garbage at all. River is accessible on foot. Path leads to a sandy (!) beach. No one around.

name: Meadow in front of restaurant
description: Nice green meadow at the foot of low hills, opposite the restaurant. Level spot, birds and flowers. Close to the road but not much traffic. Quiet at night

name: The barrels restaurant
description:
Grat place. Laid out beautifully in vineyard. Lovely terrace. Authentic Albanian kitchen, all very fresh and mostly home grown. Sort of agriturismo. 
Very friendly owner, speaks good English. Raki was on the house.

We camped in the meadow opposite to the restaurant, so no drinking and driving

name: Villa Bruçe
description: Hotel across the street from hospital. Clean comfortable rooms, fast wifi, hot showers, and gated parking. 35€ for a double room, includes a delicious breakfast. The restaurant offers lunch and dinner at standard Albanian prices. The family that runs the hotel and restaurant are very kind, we would stay again.

name: Mrizi I Zanave
description: Decent camping area for guests at their parking lot. With electricity, water and usage of the restaurant toilets.

name: Fast Food Angelos
description: Greek Style food. We enjoyed a greek salad and a mixed plate for two, including kebab. Really very good and only for very hungry people. The service is big!  Price: Albanian level

name: Tapwater fountain
description: People of Berat, drink this water. No problem

name: Bora Beach
description:
Nice small CP next to the gravel beach.
15€/ night

name: NP Llogara Hamiti
description:
Big parking place for Camping behind the Hotel. Quiet, if there are no Motos running up the road. Good food at the restaurant.
Possibility to make a round-trip to Cesar’s Pass (3km / 170m ^v, mountain hike) from the Information center.

name: Qeparo Beach
description: Nice free gravel beach. Flat places for many campers, sunny, no shade, no service, looks like a public place

name: Cemetery Mursi
description: Big, flat place between the cemetery and the lake of Mursi. The place is still under construction. Full sunshine, quiet, no zombies in the night. In the entrance house toilet and fresh water. Nice view to Mursi and the mountains.

name: Lesinitsa Lake
description:
Very nice, flat place over the small lake Lesinitsa. No service at all.
For those travelling the mountain tracks Livadhja - Cerkovicë - Kakavie it is a nice place to recover from driving challenging steep, narrov bad tracks, not suitable for big rigs.

name: Next to the river
description: Big open grass area next to a small river. There are some trees and places to light fire. Flat surfaces to pitch your tent comfortably. Quiet during the night. There's some fresh water springs some km away.

name: For tents by the road
description: We are bike tourers, and here is a nice place to pitch the tent. It's close to the road but there's almost no traffic and you can stay pretty off sight. There are some flat areas and a small creek. ok for a night.

name: Carp Pond
description:
Very nice Place on a small hill between two ponds, Sunny, flat, Suitable fpr 3-4 vehikels. The track to this place ist corrugatet (old cobblestone path), 4WD
Just ask the farmer / type restaurant, where you can get a beer ev. a pizza. Speaks only Albanian.
No service around. The frogs are not silent.

name: Vermosh Border
description: Small, quiet and simple border. We crossed from Montenegro to Albania. Straightforward and no issues.

name: Miço’s Fuel station
description:
When looking for refilling your gas bottles, Miço is very helpful and has the tools to refill gas bottles. Miço is very nice, friendly and helpful and and speaks English.
Email: femittysa@yahoo.com

name: Abandoned Foundation
description: Abandoned Foundation Near a Livestock Watering Hole. This is a secluded area near a paved road and a livestock watering hole. We parked our two motorcycles and camped behind the ruins of a stone wall. It is quiet except for the sounds of frogs from the nearby pond. A local goat herder came by and didn’t seem to care that we were camping.

name: Qafa e Rescut
description:
We could not stay at the existing places along the Drin due to heavy rain. 
This is a big flat place with low gras, away from the street (although you may hear some vehicles).
We asked the sheppard. He had no objection to our camp.
Access through a narrow track, 300m from the crossing.

name: Bar Restaurant Jozi Prejal
description: Excelent place, just before the off road starts. Good traditional food, excelent prices, very clean. Owner speaks English.

name: Lezha Park
description:
New place. Good coffee and friendly for now.
More is coming.

name: Lonely Riverside
description: Nice place about 200m away from the road direct by the river. There is a road down to the river in front of the bridge. 4x4 is nececary.

name: Sunset Camping
description: Beautiful campsite at the beach. Very friendly owners and staff. Good restaurant.

name: SH76 - Nice Panorama Route
description: SH76 is a really nice panorama route. You have beautiful views to the valley of the Vjosës river and the surrounding mountains. You will drive on a mix of stones, different gravel types and a old Romain street. 4x4 is recommended.

name: Lurë Hotel
description: Campground just below the only hotel in town. Nice view, nice little town. Campsite ok, but not too well maintained. Power, toilets and showers available. Wifi at the hotel. We paid 1300 lek for one 4x4 with rooftop tent (2 persons).

name: Samina Auto 4x4
description: 4x4 specialists, especially Land Rover. I needed a front wheel bearing replacing on my Discovery 2 after a months holiday off roading in Albania, rung them up this morning and asked if they had the part and could do it the same day. Yes they had the part and no problem could fit today!! They have English speaking staff at the office and Dari, one of the mechanics also speaks good English. Got there at lunchtime and less than two hours later the job was completed, car road tested and good to go. Absolutely fantastic service and excellent value. These guys are real Land Rover specialists and they know their stuff. If you're travelling with a Land Rover in Albania and need work these are the guys to go to, very highly recommended.

name: Place to river
description:
Its a nice place by the river where we place our tent. A 4x4 was there at the same time.

You can go directly to the water (good quality) and take a bath. its near a street where occasionally vehicles pass.

If you follow the street a few Kilometers, you will come to the TET.

name: Mineral Water Source
description: Large Source of Mineral Water flowing from the groung under pressure. Very good for drinking and filling the tanks.

name: Out of sight
description: Nice place to stay overnight in the bushes close to the street but out of sight

name: Camping and Guesthouse Rupa
description: Nice campsite, clean toilets and shower. Excellent (!) food (dinner/breakfast). Very friendly people.

name: Bar Restaurant Samueli
description: Small campsite close to the Restaurant. Toilets, shower, and Wifi at the restaurant. Good food. We paid 600 lek (4x4 with rooftop tent, 2p). Short walk to the blue eye (~2km).

name: Nice view below the road
description: Small spot below the road with nice view. Very quiet. We stayed one night.

name: Ardenica Restaurant and Wine
description: Parking of a very good restaurant and hotel on the hill with beautiful view. 800 m distant of the monastery Ardenica.

name: Guesthouse Arben Selinaj
description: Nice Guesthouse with possibility to camp. Bigger riggs stay at the river, 4x4 can drive on their lawn. Very friendly hosts. Dinner, breakfast and lunch (to go) are served and very good! We paid 20€ pp for campsite and food. We felt very welcomed!

name: Water fountain
description: Fountain along the Road to Shebenik-Jabllanica National Parc

name: Shebenik-Jabllanica NATIONAL park
description: Small fountain with drinking water, See picture

name: Camp spot at river Vjosa
description: Follow a small dirt road down to the river and you will find several spots also suitable for larger vans. No 4x4 needed.

name: Water Fountain
description: Water fountain near Blue Eye. Locals get their water here too.

name: Bujtina Vjosa
description:
Campground with a shower and a toilet. Camping is free but it is expected to eat at the restaurant. The food is traditional, freshly handmade with local ingredients. Prices are very OK (25€ for a big meal and a few beers). There is also the possibility to dump blackwater (not for free).
The campsite is situated beside a beautiful river where you can take  a bath or a swim

name: River Camping
description: "Welcome to River Camping! This camping ground is located 4,5km near Shkodra. From here we have a wonderful view of Rozafa castle and river Drin. In this river, you can also swim, and you have everything you need to enjoy a proper rest, such as toilets, electricity, water, and Wi-Fi. This camping ground is located in a very favorable position, only 4 km away from Shiroka, and many other Tourist Attractions, which you can visit by bike. You're welcome!

name: Wild camping along river
description: good spot to camp, follow the path down to the river  can be reached with a vehicle. the ground is rocky but there is a grassy place in the woods. careful strong current.

name: Rruga Vincenco D'Paoli
description: The site is situated in a built up area just off the motorway. The family are very welcoming and the site is secure with security. There is a pool with a bar and electric for a couple of campers. I would recommend for a stop over. It is all very new and the family plan to develop it more shortly.

name: Mountain Top campsites
description:
Several spots along this switch back gravel/rock path up to the communication towers on top. We camped at the pin, but there are spots with more wind protection or for bigger groups further up. 
A view of the Sea on one side and Pine trees on the other. No trash up here, yet. 
4x4 Recommended, but I'm sure someone with a 2wd car has made it up!

name: Place under the old Bridge
description:
Quiet wild Camping Spot
Old Bridge 
Next to the River

name: Abandoned campground
description: On Google maps this spot is mentioned as Kamping Gracen. It is accessible via a bumpy dirt road (only 4x4). Very quit (only 2 cars passed by) and splendid mountain view.

name: Waterside
description: A very bumpy road leads you among olive trees to this beautiful lonesome spot. You need a car with high clearance and not higher than 2.4m. The noise of the road is barely audible, just cicadas.

name: Eco camping valona
description:
Eco friendly camping. A lot of shadow and a sea breeze. 6 minutes walk to the sandy beach. Check it out and feel the indy vibe. You're sold when you meet the nice, english speaking hosts. 
follow the sign on the main road and follow the track in the woods. Good for tents and campervan or rent a tent at the spot, they have places where you can sleep on hay. Also possible to ride horses on the beach...

name: Riverside
description:
Stayed for one night at this beautiful place by the river bend. You have direct access to the river (many stones, but there is a small cleared and sandy area to bathe in) and two levels to build your camp. The upper level is sandy and the lower (and mainly the rest of the spot) is based on stones.
No sheep, dogs or anyone were around. The spot can be seen from the street, but only a few cars passed during the day and only two by night. 
4x4 not necessary. 
Stayed there with two dogs and a baby in a rooftop tent. 
Also enough place for bigger rigs.

name: Next to Buna river close to border
description: On our way to Montenegro we could not find a nice spot near Shkroder lake so we drove towards the border and found this beautiful spot. It is next to the Buna river on a nice flat meadow with mountain view. About 1,5 km from the main road on a gravel road (no 4x4 required). Very quiet, nobody passed by.

name: Motor Service LENCI
description:
Small motorcycle mechanic in Tirana. There are not too many options around. Brought a KTM 1090 here for a simple oil change with no issues. Friendly and competent enough service. 

No English or Italian spoken. Best to call (or text) in advance at +355 69 256 3233. If you need parts/fluids they will probably need a bit of time to find them.

name: riverside out of sight before permet
description:
Beautiful place right next to Vjose river a couple of km before Permet.
Just follow the easy white road next to the main road to Permet.
Stayed here in super high season and only 4 vans here. Lot of space for motorhome and tents, not too much shade but incredible river bath in the morning

name: Alavana Apartment
description: If you really must come to Velapoja then this is a nice enough place. Run by the very friendly Martin and family it's close enough to the beach and restaurants etc. Motorcycle parking on-site no problems.

name: VW Mechanic - Lenci
description:
Lenci is an english speaking highly knowledgeable mechanic who is specialized on VW T1 - T5.
You can contact him via whatsapp.

name: next to the river bed
description: nobody here some places in this area around. 4g ..

name: oda
description: Traditional Albanian cuisine, friendly staff and beautiful sitting outside. Serves also vegetarian and vegan meals. For the evening you may need to reservate. They charge 2€/p for live music, but the atmosphere is great.

name: Parking Tirana
description: Good parking next to the City. We paid 800 lek for 24 hours. We have shade from the trees und we feel save. The price is more than other places, but friendly and enough space for your van or big rig. Water is available

name: fresh mountain water
description: In the bend of the road there is a big rock on the left hand side (direction shkoder) where a pipe sticks out. great clean water, even on rainy days where most water sources turn muddy

name: Restaurant Vëni Gjishit
description: Next to the restaurant is the possibility to stay overnight for 10 €. You can use the toilet and shower for free and you can get food and drinks in the restaurant. The place is located next to the river with a beautiful view

name: Antigonea parking
description: Place ist right at the end of the road to ancient Antigonea excavation site. Big parking space on tarmac, even, no shades, no amenities. No problem staying overnight, very quiet place in the night. Over the day some visitors to site (Fee is 300all pp). Fantastic views over the valley. Very Clean, no garbage. We stayed one night and had a very good sleep.

name: In front of abandoned hotel Natyra
description:
There is a large abandoned hotel near the beach with a wooded area with space for cars and tents.

It gets really dark quickly due to the density of trees

Public showers are available on the beach to the north

name: Free Camping
description: Free tent camping w/toilet. Has inexpensive restaurant

name: wild camping parku Lugina e Valbones
description:
Under the main road, off-road only. 
Surrounded by mountains. Sculptural view!
No passage on the main road. Perfect for a night. Mushrooms in October.

name: incredible view near Mëzi
description:
Place only for one van on a side of a dirty road. Calm at night, some locals passed during the morning. Crazy sunrise worth it to wake up! 360 degrees mountain view! 
We met two really friendly locals who wont appreciate if you let rubbish around. they invite us to drink something with them. we had a good evening!

name: Near river away from main road
description: nice place for a short stay. no access to the river but a little bit away from the main road. take the small dirt road in the direction to the river to get inside. if your standing at the dumpside you went to far

name: Xho‘s Forest
description: Beautiful and new guesthouse with safe bicycle/motorbike parking. Cozy rooms with good mattress, fast WiFi and very quiet setting in a beautiful garden in walking distance from everywhere. Washing machine available, super delicious breakfast made with love included. We paid 26€ in a double room and huge breakfast. More than you can see in the picture. Entry is through a private alley of Kiwi trees, so no high cars or vans (they go next door to „Niko‘s“ or park on the street).

name: Spot next to the river
description: Big area for camper van. Water source next to it (spring just downriver left, coming from the mountain). River next to it to bath in. You could possibly pitch a tent just a little upstream but we didn’t check it out.

name: street damaged
description: street damaged. also for 4*4 not to drive

name: lekël
description: suberb drinken water from a mountain stream. locals come to film up their cannisters

name: Nice spot near small waterfalls
description: On the east side of the bridge, follow the track that goes uphill. After +/- 50m you will find a grassy spot for a tent (2 max) or camper (4x4). You can walk to the small river below to wash yourself or get water. Hardly any garbage here. Let’s keep it this way.

name: Lajthize
description: Good fresh water across from cafe/fish store.

name: meadow 4x4
description: beautiful place but entering only 4x4 for the first 10 meter

name: Astonishing free camp with splendid views!
description:
Astonishing place, views and perfect green grass. 

I had the time so see the area and look for spots and this is the one guys. 
I didn’t like the other marked places. Lots of trash and no views from this splendid place. 

Surprisingly no trash at this location. Several fire places, short green grass to pinch your tent, place for several vehicles and shade or sun (whatever you prefer 🙃)

I would say that in the case of rain can be muddy so check the place before you enter. 4x4 is not needed and ground clearance neither. For example I saw a girl with a long ford transit getting here like nothing. 

The views from the mountains are simply spectacular. The oranges, yellows and reds in this particular time of the year makes it the perfect location. 

No noise at all. Probably in high season you can hear the cars passing by (I don’t know how crowded Valbona gets in summer time) but in October is an amazing relaxing beautiful location. 

Spent 2 nights here and for shore is the best free camp spot that i slept in Albania so far (and I free camp a lot)

Hope the info is helpful.

🙏

name: On the Vjosa
description: Drive down to the cement factory, skirt it as you go right, drive to the beach. Nice spot, plenty of room.

name: By the bunker
description: Large, grass, flat spot, close to a side road but private.

name: new water fountain
description: good pressure, hose attachment, good water

name: Lake wild camp
description:
Trying to find the other spots (I couldn’t). I just follow the gravel road from Thane. Some parts are little tricky but with no rain and slowly all kind of vehicles can do it but not the big rigs. Some ground clearance for some parts will be appreciated but i saw a mercedes sedan passing by early so…

The place is huge. No shade, grass all over and pretty flat areas. Trash in some parts but i did find my clean spot. 

Not the nicest wild camp but not bad at all. Specifically for bikers & motorcyclists its fun to get here and a good place to rest. 

The place is EXTREMELY quiet. Spent a beautiful quiet night in here.

name: Windmill Shkodra Gesthouse Camping & Grill
description:
Keep going past the scrap yards and you’ll find the campsite. 
About 10 pitches with electric.

name: Water Pump and Filter Station
description:
Water tab with 1/2 inch thread next to a pump station. Runs nicely but doesn‘t have too much pressure. Had to use my pump to get it upwards into my tanks. Alternatively there's a pressure pipe next to it. you need a 1.5 inch thread connector though…
Friendly locals, come here to get their drinking supply. One man said the water is being pumped through 4 giant filters. Might be true, the water tastes very neutral. Good!

name: Abandoned House with beautiful views
description:
Moderator note: IOverlander does not recommend to camp in abandoned houses.

Beautiful spot directly to the water. Is an abandoned house made of stones in front of the sea. 

I would suggest 4x4 but i saw a local with a wolskwagen Polo with no problems at all. 
Length and high of the vehicle would be an issue. Don’t recommend long and low rigs.

I put my tent in one of the terraces of the house and was beautiful quiet night. 
Also there is some flat spots to park vehicles with now issues but again, not for big rigs. 

In the way to this spot they are several spots for wild camping to.

There is some old bunkers around and of course, trash. 

Super nice spot if not for the trash.

name: Nderliza
description:
Stopped for 2 nights. Ideal if you don’t want to cross the river to the campsite.  

The road is tarmac all the way now. Managed fine in our 6.7m Motorhome. 

At the start of the trail to the beautiful Blue Eye.

name: Perfect spot in front of Laguna e Nartës
description:
Beautiful spot at the end of the asphalt in front of the beautiful Nartës lake. 
There is a flat big wooden structure, that’s where i put my tent.
Is the begging of the wooden path that takes to Shën Mërisë Monastery. 
The surroundings are pretty pretty! 
I asked a fisherman and of course as always in Albania he said no problem at all to camp here. 
Also there is flat areas for almost any kind of vehicle. 
I was going to the next places marked in the app but was late and I didn’t wanted to risk it through the gravel road and this solution was just perfect! 
Perfect place for bikers and motorcyclists.
Hope you enjoy it

🙏

name: Watergates
description: Nice Place near the road but quiet by the day and night

name: Water/Quelle
description: Near the street, locals get here their drinking water

name: Vjosa riverbank
description: Nice riverbank away from the road. Very quiet at night. Theres a small field track leading to the sandbank, the very last turn down to it is quite steep and can be slippery. Requires 4x4. However you can also stay just above in a unused grassy field, houses are in sight the road is not. In the bushes next to the river is a lot of trash, as everywhere…

name: Solid field beside the road with good view
description: Big enough also for bigger campers or more than one. Good for a overnight stay. Nearly no cars passing by. Can be a bit windy.

name: Laj Thaj
description: In a sort of strip mall.  Seven washers that take 10kg and five dryers.  200 Leke to wash and 100 Leke for 20 minutes drying.  It takes two sessions.  Bring coins; detergent for sale. Clean place with WiFi.  Not a great deal of parking around but we found a small lot nearby at these coordinates: 41.32092, 19.83644.  100 Leke an hour or 500 for 24 hours.

name: Scoturk
description: Small guesthouse that offers camping with 4 RV sites and a lawn for tents.  Matt and Muge are extremely friendly and helpful.  Very close to beach and lots of restaurants.Good wifi, power, water, cassette dumping, bathrooms with showers.  4G reception.

name: Camping Ecuador
description:
Lovely lady runs this place.  Clean bathrooms and good wifi.
Right next to a small pebble beach with some palms and a river mouth.  Individual sites with power and water.  Hit showers.  4G signal.  15 eu a night for 2 ppl with camper.  Walk to shops and restaurants.

name: Pjetraj Group
description: Very friendly guys in that parts shop. Got for my rig long wiper blades and a Coffee for free.

name: Camping Freskia
description: Small campsite near Theth village. Nice view over Theth valley. Toilet, hot shower and WiFi. Since the road SH 21 from Shkoder to Theth is totally paved its easy to reach with all kinds of vehicles. Just the acces road to the campsite is unpaved and a bit steep, so possibly not suitable for big riggs without 4wd.

name: Laundry Speed Queen
description: Very quick and uncomplicated! They have big machines and a soft washing powder, which has not a strong smell. After 1,5 h all our stuff was washed and dried! Perfect - for only 7-8€!!

name: Kastrati Kast & Gas
description: Gas bottle refill. Whithout any problems. Ours was a german grey bottle.

name: Vila Masha
description: Restaurant with traditional albanian food. Was very good; a bit more expensive - but it‘s also a bit more than only fries and meat ;) on the other side of the street is a parksite, where we spent the night. We asked at the restaurant for permission and it was okay for them.

name: Auto service Vaska
description: This is the best mechanic in Vlora maybe even in all of Albania. Vaska and his son Kristi are amazing friendly and welcoming people that can help you out with any mechanical issue in your car/van.

name: Julton hotel park
description: Hotel big parking  with tree..water ..eletricity..info of the city ..shower. Grey water . 14 km from bus 1 min away to the centre 40 cent ticket.8 km from the centre.english.

name: Durbaku hotel
description: Small, simple and economical hotel. We paid 10€ for 2 pers. For a room with bathroom. If you wish, the hotel also does restaurant and cafe.

name: By the Grace Motors
description: A small and very well equipped workshop. The owner speaks perfect English and of course knows where to get spares and other services. Two vehicle lifts and great mechanics. Highly recommended.

name: Reservoir / Lake south shore
description:
stayed with 4x4 / roof top tent 

access bumpy, good ground clearance advisable

flat ground, very quiet, seems to be public ground, talked to bird-hunting young man, all friendly, area is apparently home to snakes - we survived …

name: Albania Border Station
description:
very Nice
friendly
no problem
very quick

name: Brooklin hotel
description:
hotel in the pedestrian street is the city. 
double room at 2,000 lek (for 2 people) there is also a suite at 3,500 lek. good wifi

name: Auto Market
description:
Has a problem on my BMW F700GS and he helped me as much as a car mechanic can help.
Very helpful, but no english, so only google translator.
cash only payment

name: Riversidde
description:
Quiet place, not disturbed by anyone.
The neighbor came to welcome us.

name: Divjaka beach camping
description:
Just off the road that runs through the national park. At the time of writing the beach was very accessible to any type of car. In the evening there was even some drifting and ‘playing’ around with cars by locals on the beach as well but this ended as soon as the sun went under. 

Police drove by but did not make any remarks that we were camping here. No signs that it would not be allowed either.

name: Corniche with a view
description: Small place for 1-2 tents with motorcycle or 1 car ATTENTION VISIBLE FROM THE ROADS!!!!!!!

name: Restorant Ana Carshove
description: Good small restaurant serving traditional albanian food - owner Ana speaks greek english and italian

name: Blue Eye Finiq
description: At the exit of SH99 to Blue Eye there’s a new parking for Camper & Caravan & Buses - it‘s  not more possible to go until the Blue Eye by car - there’s a barrier at the dam - walking distance from the barrier is approximately 1km - parking fee for campers see picture

name: Vertigo Hostel
description:
Nice basic hostel.
9€ for 4 bedroom dormitory.
Motorcycle friendly

name: SH8 south of Lukove
description: A quiet spot for a night or two next to the road from/to Saranda - beautiful view above the sea & down to Lukova Beach & surrounded by olive trees - no one is bothering you here

name: Jonufer Beach
description: Small gravel spot for a night or two next to the road to Vlorë - access to the a small beach underneath - locals come here for swimming - quiet at night

name: In the Oliveyard with amazing view
description: if you follow the street down to the beach there is a dirt road that goes into the olive yards. possible to drive on it with biecycle, Motorbike, and car (idealy 4x4). you can stop earlyer but to get a bit out of site i placed my tent behind the hilltop, the dirt road keeps going there. lots of terreces. the view is 270° over the sea and hills. is on the lee side of the wind. be aware that it is a agricultural place, so owner could show up. lots of Moskitos (in May)

name: Imoto Honda motorcycle service center
description: They changed the oil in my motorcycle. Excellent service and good craftsman. English speaking Orges ( the mechanic) will you the best service. Highly recommend.

name: Bus Terminal Berat
description: At the bus terminal of Berat there’s space for big rigs for a night or two - no one bothered us - quiet at night but can get busy in the morning

name: Promenade Durres
description: Parking lot at the Beach Promenade of Durres - busy at daytime - quiet at night - bars restaurants & city Center close by

name: Torno
description: General mechanical shop if you’re looking for nuts and bolts etc

name: Beach
description: Public sand beach with lot of space to park under pine trees or direct on the beach - bit dirty but very quiet at night - no one is bothering you here - locals come here for swimming

name: wild camp near phone mast
description: Long grassy sward, large flat area by the side of the road but shielded by trees. Locals welcoming. Space for several vehicles. Big rigs would fit on here but very tricky to get them up the road to it so marked as no for them

name: Uli, Lake Mursin
description: You stand directly on the water, with a wonderful view of Mursi. Super nice operators. Beer garden and restaurant. Very tasty meals. Simply great here.

name: Kafe Pojana
description: Potable water tap outside free to use. locals drink direct without treatnent

name: Kafe Pojana
description: Only restaurant there is. Excellent local food, cheese, some canned drinks and tea and coffe

name: River Valley near Papaj
description: Next to the road there is a flattish area of river gravel, space for three or four cars. Next to road but locals friendly and encouraging. be careful of sudden river rise after rain though.

name: merlika rooms
description: Private room 25 euro with breakfast with secure motorcycle parking, camping free , restaurant , sunday have a traditional albanian dance , sleep inside skanderberg castle , arthur the owner is very kind and very understand about traveller need and bikers , reasonable food price

name: Lamia's Garden
description: An Albanian Family Welcome good people in their House and Garden to camp, sleep in rooms and eat traditional food.

name: place for tent near highway
description: nice place for tent near highway. we went there by bicycle but you can drive there by car

name: Grande Roma
description: Really decent and good value Italian. For around 500lk you can get a pizza big enough for 2 - really good quality

name: Wildcamping next to abandoned kulla
description:
Hidden meadow next to an abandoned kulla. The place is relatively even. Great view into the valley. Little traffic, we were completely alone there. 

Access (coming from Theth) refer to the picture.

name: Plateau with a view at Liqeni Qafë Mollës
description: Plateau with 180 Degree view at Liqeni Qafë Mollës. Access via a gravel road, 4x4 recommended. Relatively even areal. Good internet connection. We were absolutely alone.

name: Blinisht
description: Secluded area next to Blinisht with a great view of the mountains and the Fan river. For access, 4x4 recommended. Space for approx 3 cars. Relatively level area. The only downside is the mosquitoes (06/23).

name: Place over Çerem with great mountain view
description: Nice camping spot above Çerem in the direction of Dobërdol. Fantastic mountain view, even (small) areal directly next to the gravel road. Path is only passable with gear reduction and ground clearance.

name: Alpini hotel
description: Very nice place in the mountains with a view. Very nice people. The camping place is next to a small hotel.

name: Molla Guest House
description: Nice little spot next to guesthouse. Beautiful area and view. Lots of space around you.

name: Beautiful spot in the mountains.
description: Very beautiful spot away from the main road. Access via gravel road, steep but easy for high clearance vehicles. We saw nobody during the time we were there. Far away from houses or villages. Big part of area is flat

name: Restaurant and picnic spot aan Mat rivier
description: Nice quite place on river bank next to restaurant. They serve delicious traditional Albanees food. Large area with shade. Nice people.

name: Near the Lagoon
description: a nice and shady place in the wood. The park ranger told us, we can camp everywhere except in front of the visitor centre. You need a little bit Clearance to reach this place. But you don't need 4x4.

name: Siempre Viva Dhermi
description: Affordable accommodation with large secure courtyard for cars / Motos. It’s a little out the way but cheaper than near the beach and the host is super friendly and helpful. In addition the walk to the beach and back is a good little workout!

name: Beautiful view at the sea
description: Space for one 4x4. Some fishing boats in the sea, but we saw no fishermen. It was a Friday. Very quiet.

name: Albanian / Greek border
description: June 2023 - Fairly painless and quiet border between Albanian and Greece. Passports and bike paperwork quickly scanned but we did not have to show proof of insurance. Petrol station on the Albanian side for cheaper fuel.

name: Bujtina Dini
description: Nice quiet, relaxing hotel/ restaurant in a narrow valley surrounded by vine yards. Can be found on booking.com

name: Water tap at Kastrati gas station
description: There is a water tap at the corner of the gas station KASTRATI. They don’t speak English, but still understood me asking for water and let us fill up our 200l water tank here

name: Nice place with perfect view to the lake, at a plateu...for max 2 cars
description: Camps pot for max 2 vehicles. Maybe if its windy it's not so good.

name: Gomisteri
description: Mecanic specialised in welding. He welded a aluminium part in our door of our Landrover Defender. Very nice. Does not speak English. Does speak Italian. Not expensive at all. There is a coffee bar on the other side of the road.

name: Panorama Viewpoint
description: We parked the car on the road in a corner and had an amazing view. If you camp with a tent you can pitch it at the viewing point. The point is not accessible for cars. Recommend a 4x4 or at least high clearance.

name: Camping Place Peshtan Mirela Muka
description:
Established campground close to famous hiking trails in south Albania, just next to Vjosa River.

Breakfast and Dinner prepared by the owners with local traditional food.

Owners are hiking guides for the region and host guests in either their campground or their three rooms.

Camping Place Peshtan Mirela Muka
+355 69 317 2603
https://maps.app.goo.gl/gQyG4MrRzkoehD8Y6?g_st=ic

name: Old Navy Bunkers
description: Here you can visit old navy bunkers built in the cliffs. Take a bright flashlight with you ;-)

name: plazhi i gjeneralit bungalow and camping
description:
beautiful beach campsite in the small and secluded bay of Gjeneralit.
wide choice of bungalows (base price 55 euros). economic self-service on the equipped beach, in addition to the restaurant. there is also a small grassy area used for camping, with bathrooms but no shade.
we camped for free one night on the final stretch of free beach without any problems. free wifi and super nice staff. a little oasis away from the crowds. absolutely recommended!
bellissimo campeggio sulla spiaggia nella piccola e isolata baia di Gjeneralit.
ampia scelta di bungalow (prezzo base 55 euro). economico self service sulla spiaggia attrezzata, oltre al ristorante . c'è anche una piccola zona erbosa adibita a campeggio, con bagni ma senza ombra.
noi abbiamo campeggiato gratis una notte sul tratto finale di spiaggia libera senza alcun problema. free wifi e personale supergentile. una piccola oasi lontana dalla folla. assolutamente consigliato !

name: IBC Kamping
description:
Small road-side campsite and cafè just past the Montenegro-Albania border.

The campsite is right in front of the owners' house and you can either pitch your tent in his well-trimmed lawn or park your car in a very flat gravel courtyard.

Both spaces have gates to prevent access from the road.

It is close to the main road so there is heavy traffic during the day but not so much after midnight.

The owners also have an apartment in the attic of the house with 2 double bedrooms that was offered to us for €20.

They have a hose to refill your water, toilets at the cafè and a full bathroom (with shower) inside the apartment which they allowed us to use because there were no other guests staying there.

Owners speak Albanian ONLY but the WiFi is very fast so you can Google Translate your way around!

Happy Overlanding!

name: Hotel Campingground Culaj
description:
A hotel with 15 parking spaces for motorhomes, we have 8 hotel rooms which can accommodate up to 18 people. We have place for bikers to put the tender and all the facilities for them. 
5 minute walk to Lake Skadar in culaj. 
We have restaurant and bar which can drink and eat. We have nice garden and terrace that we can happily accommodate our guests.
Very quiet location.

name: Campania in Albania Campsite
description:
A quiet, small campsite with 8 pitches for caravans/motor homes. And many nice places for tents. The place is ideal with its location to remain undisturbed. Electricity, water, washing machine, Wi-Fi, gray water disposal and disposal of chemical toilets included in the price.
From here you can hike to the surrounding mountains, there is a restaurant in the village and nearby is the Llogora National Park for hiking.

name: Riverside
description: Grassy Spot at the River with wonderfull view of the mountains around.

name: Guest House Mantho
description: Guest House with both shared bathroom & en-suite rooms.  Cost €38 / 4000 Leke for 1 person for 2 nights with breakfast in am en-suite room. Just over 1km to the main part of the city. Secure parking for a few cars & motorbikes. Good hearty breakfasts.

name: Camp On the river
description: Spot right on the river . Only accessible with 4*4.no trash around .good fresh swim

name: end of broken road
description:
alternative camp if you done want to pay for the camp site or stay in a dusty car park. 

situated at the one of the old broken roads above the canyon (cross the bridge before the car park). all the way at the end before a power substation, and sites on the last bend of the road that opened up into a big flat gravel area. 

the road is truly broken and fissured 4x4 and low range necessary. might get something the size of a unimog may get up and down but could have issues if someone comes the other way.

no water up there or anything. good phone reception 4g.

name: Camping Erebar Stone
description: Really very nice place in a family's garden. Very great hospitality! The food that the mum cooks is delicious. You are welcomed with raki and coffee. I highly recommend this place!

name: Tyres and wash - Kastriot
description: Very friendly and helpful, changed my blown tyre with a spare second hand one. Do manual wash too.

name: Huge and nice place near de lake
description: Huge and nice place near de lake, very quiet.

name: Riverbed
description: Take smaller old road beside E853, then it's only a few meters off road to several grassy spots, should be feasible by 2WD. Access to river with a small path (at our time of visit in July), although one bigger step included.

name: Riverbed
description: Several spots here, directly on riverbed. Small, a little bumpy road down, but feasible by 2WD. Larger vans might have to stay up close to the street. Park a little on the side, river ravters get out here.

name: in the dunes by the sea
description:
nice little spot in the dunes by a line tree next to the beach. spot can be accessed via sand tracks off the tar road.

2wd should be generally fine but mine out for patches of deeper sand when going off the tracks.

loads of site options in the immediate area suitable for various sizes of vehicle.

standard amounts of Albanian trash but not the worst. expect to fill a bag or two.

right next to the sea but the water is shallow.

no water or amenities but there are beach bars about 1km down coast towards vlore.

good signal 4g on Vodafone.

name: Traveler Hostel
description: New Hostel for 2023. Motorbike & bicycle friendly, place out front next to the rental bicycles away from the main road where you can hang out and work on the bike. Very nice owners/staff and someone there 24hrs. Rooms clean and comfortable and affordable. Fast wifi throughout. Lots of social areas including outside area out front where everyone hangs out in the evening for beers. Quieter work area upstairs. Centre of town and next to a local market.

name: Tent spot, far side of meadow
description: In the same clearing/meadow that’s on the map for vehicles. If camping / moto camping there’s a spot in the far corner behind a small mound offering more wind protection (and to be a little more hidden) next to the trees. Just enough space for a two man rent but can clear some rocks for more if needed. Can still enjoy the view from the mound! Strong 4G signal.

name: Great view, flat area from old foundations
description: Great view lots of flat area and old foundations of buildings. Just down from the iron mine.

name: Kalaja e Skënderbeut
description: Open meadow next to the Castle rock. Some flat ground and a nice view. Intermittent signal

name: Dibra camping
description: very friendly place with facilities and a lake nearby. I arrived cycling and I met another cyclist there and the guy who operates the place helped us a lot with everything.

name: Kruja Vista Camping
description: Nice camping among the ancient olive trees, with a full panorama of the city, mountains, castle and the endless horizont. New toilets and showers.

name: English speaking mechanic
description: English speaking mechanic. Helpt us with a broken fuseball. The part was quickly delivered and replaced. The name of the garage is: Autoservis & Autolarje "Rrjolli"

name: Bicycle friendly wild camp
description: It's an open meadow. Extremely easy to go there with the bicycle and the terrain allows to isolate okish from the road noise. A Shepard passed in the evening but he seemed chilled. That gave me confidence to stay until 8 am and then left

name: Dobërdoll lake
description:
Spot near lake Sylbicë, with rain 4x4 is advised. ground is not even, so use some rocks or something to even your car.

Lake is not great for swimming because of sinking sand after 2 meters, we could however freshen ourselves up here.

Warning, there is no mobile reception.

Seen a few cars in the night, but not many. However we were sheltered enough behind the dunes.

name: water
description: water Station, you can parking on the opposite

name: direktly by the park
description: street parking between stadion and city park. the park is beautiful for walking and enjoy, no water or shower here, the City is nearly, generell it's quiet, for one night ok.

name: Eco social Farm (hostel/camping)
description:
They have an interesting project to increase social inclusion.
it's located around 7km to Skoder (easy to hitchhiking). We stayed in a dorm and payed 5€pppn.
There was some campervan staying too, we didn't see anyone camping but I think they have space for camping.
there is a comunal kitchen and warm showers.
https://www.ecosocialfarm.com/

name: Shkolla hostel
description:
Nice hostel, open just in Summer time, we were at the end of September and he told us we were the last guests. there are 3 dorm, share kitchen, shower and toilet are basic but good enough
the owner doesn't speak much English but was very friendly and if you speak Italian will be a plus. He works in the Restaurant Markos in the main road at the grill, in case there is no one at the hostel.
Gjipes beach are around one hour walking, we go from the Shkolle an the way is a bit unclear, I think is better to go to Illias and from there walk down

name: Villa Shpetim Zogaj
description:
It is a guest house, we were in a double room, with small kitchen and private toilet, the owners live down stairs, nice couple but don't speak much English, we payed 14€ per night.
there is a supermarket close by, the beach was close too.

name: Kombëtar Lure park East
description: Meadow along the road, level and big rig friendly. The road further up the mountain towards the south lakes is blocked by stones. Level spot along the road. Access only 4x4, high ground clearance. No people, except for a shepherd in the morning. Vodafone Albania reception.

name: Perondi ECO-Camping
description: Small campground along a guesthouse “Cortina House” Very welcoming hosts, Vera and Erwin. Almost level places in the olive garden. Not suitable for big rigs. Now in 2023 places for tents and 4x4 with RTT. Next year plans for campervans, access to the garden is too steep for vans with 2WD. 10 euro for 2 persons with a 4x4 with RTT per night.

name: Birra Korca
description: Birra Korca is a traditional brewery. you can visit the Produktion and nearby are some places to stay.

name: Dragostunjë Wild Camp
description:
Parking beside the road. You can probably find space for a few vehicles parked after each other within reasonable distance, but they can't be much longer or wider than a normal car since there are bushes and the road is mostly narrow.

The road leads to a hydro power station control house. It is usually unmanned and only occasionally someone goes there. It has a gate, so no vehicles passing by going somewhere else.

You get a nice view, cell phone reception, and fresh water from the stream running along the road. The locals drink the water further downstream. This of course also means you must absolutely not pollute it in any way.

As of now, there is no trash at all at this site, which is unusual for Albania... Let's hope we can keep it that way.

name: Camping next to tomorrico river
description: Very nice camp spot next to the river when following the river bed. Grassy and flat.

name: Free Camping IDRIZI
description: Wild free camping. Van , motorcycle, bikes, tents, and other forms of camping. Please be kind and leave clean. For the moment is free. 500 m from the seaside. 2 km from the city. Nice place to stay.

name: Deda 4x4
description: Good 4x4 service, spare parts in stock for Landrover, Landcruiser etc. Takes time for you to get back on track.

name: Lakeside Olive Grove
description: Was hopeful for some of the other spots around here, but didn’t like any of them. This one is much better. Take the small dirt road on the right as you enter Thane. Eventually you will come to a small 4 way junction. Take a right here, head down past a small cemetery until you get to the water. Nice flat private spot just to the left. Beautiful views!

name: road
description: good drinking water beside the road hillside

name: Black Drin riverside
description:
Lovely place at the riverside. Hidden from the road, quiet at night. (almost) no trash. Great view, place for two, max three tents. Current too strong for swimming, but wash body/dishes possible. 4G Internet connection. Only reachable by bicycle or motorcycle. Too narrow for 4x4.

A few meters from the road bridge is a path down a dried up river bed. Follow it 50m to get to the river. With Offroad-driving knowledge also doable with big bike / luggage.

name: Agri Camping Italiano - Eucalyptus
description: Nice new campsite from an italian couple. We were there with the bicycle and a tent. It has a clean shower and toilets. There is also a pool. If the door is closed, you can call them via whatsapp (the phone number is on google).

name: Beach
description:
Sandy beach
 the path is a bit difficult.  Turn right in front of the Market & Café.  take the left-hand route from it.
 stick to Google.
  don't take the route through town!
 about 3.5km. but the route is not always as bad as at the beginning.
 At the end you seem to reach a dead end.  Use the open gate on the left side.
 the path is narrow.  not particularly high.
 the short stretch is tunnel through trees.
 Be careful, the beach is very sandy.
 the beach is not overcrowded.  very nice and quiet

 We drive a Sprinter 316cdi without all-wheel drive


Sandstrand 
der Weg ist etwas beschwerlich. vor dem Market & Café rechts weg. die linke Fahrstrecke davon nehmen.
haltet euch an Google.
 nehmt nicht den Weg durch den Ort!
ungefähr 3.5km. die Strecke ist aber nicht immer so schlecht wie am Anfang.
zum Schluss kommt ihr anscheinend in einer Sackgasse. das offe Tor linke Seite nutzen.
der Weg ist eng. nicht sonderbar hoch.
die kurze Strecke ist Tunnel von Bäumen.
Vorsicht Strand sehr sandig. 
der Strand ist nicht überlaufen. sehr schön und ruhig

wir fahren einen Sprinter 316cdi ohne Allrad

name: Beach
description:
langer Sandstrand mit vielen kleinen Strand Restaurant. 
eine Stranddusche gefunden

long sandy beach with many small beach restaurants.
found a beach shower

name: Beautiful quiet Place at the dirt road near Zaloshnje
description: Close to the dirt road on a beautiful green with an awesome view over the mountains

name: Camping Village Gardenland
description:
Established Campsite inside the Gardenland Ressort. 
One tent for two people is 5€ including electricity, Wifi, showers and toilet. There is a restaurant on the property and it's very quiet.

name: seaside Potami beach
description:
this is the end of the road right in front of the beach. 
perfect for overnight and long week stays. lots of campers parked along the street. great views and cold plunge next to the hotel

name: COBIAL spring water
description: free spring water off the highway. taste great and all the locals refill here

name: Tap with drinking water
description: easy parking next to a tap where you can fill up your tank

name: Pulbardhes Beach parking lot
description: We stayed 1 night on this parking lot, October 2023. Access to the beach through one of the 2 restaurants. During the day quite some cars parked (so I wouldn't set up table and chairs etc) but in the night we were there with 2 campers. We had a drink at the restaurant and watched the sunset from the beach. Sea can be quite rough so a bit noisy in the night.

name: Ecosocial farm
description: There is a campsite and some rooms as well, in a big area with dogs, cats, ducks in the nature. Not far away from Shkoder. It's an eco-friendly project, you can volunteer if you want. The place is popular to the cyclist community who can stay with free donation.

name: Picnic area
description: Space next to a picnic area and a fountain. Quiet for a night out. Accessible only with 4x4

name: Moto Servis Altini
description:
Very nice workshop , the owner Altini very friendly and speak English . And helped me a lot with my motorbike . High reccomended . 
+355692407990

name: Rare shady spot near Shkodër
description:
Small shady camp spot just off a quiet road. The ground is a bit rocky, but there are spots for small tents. The site is also free from rubbish, which is nice.

Access is via a partially paved road. Some rocky unpaved sections but still passable in a 2WD in all weather. If you don't have much clearance, you might not be able to drive all the way in to the site due to the rocks.

name: Kantina Mani
description:
Welcome to Kantina Mani, a charming and authentic biological winery, situated on the beautiful Lake Shkodra. They are a 20-minute drive from Montenegro and situated only 7 km from Shkoder city centre, and on-route to the popular destinations of Vermosh and Thethi in the Albanian Alps.

Fatjon and his wife are the most pleasant hosts and speak fluent English, Italian and German. There is space for up to 7 campers within the vineyard with a great view over the Accursed Mountains. Toilet, shower, fresh water, electricity, wifi and trash bins are available.  

You can do a wine tasting or have an authentic dinner at their gated property. Ideal for families and couples. For other information you can call.

name: Wild spot near the lake
description: Reservoir off the road - easy dirt track to access (by bike) great spot for a tent with lovely Mountain Views. Couple of shepherds with their animals going by but everyone is friendly

name: Auto Golemi
description: Another place with a lot of Land Rover parts (also Defender!) and friendly mechanics. Replaced our broken coil spring with a genuine second hand one for 50 euros.

name: under the ledge
description: Under The Ledge is a small capacity Campground in Albania Alps next to the biggest waterfall in Albania and it runs seasonally.

name: South of Vlorë, on the cliffs overlooking the sea.
description: When you follow SH8 from Vlorë to the south go to the neighbourhood Radhimë. The road there passes apartments and goes up until it ends in a roundabout. In the right corner of the roundabout is a small gravelroad. It’s bumpy and a little bit steep but you will arrive at a little meadow overlooking the sea. Really quiet and hardly any carbage. 4x4 recommended for the last part. Not accessible for big rigs

name: Guest House Bashkimi
description: Guest House and camping. Local catering possible. Mountain shelter standard. Electricity from a generator and the sun, so there are restrictions - as in the entire village
